title: Has anyone confessed to having a crush on someone and how did it go? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have confessed to my crush on October 22 , 2011 and it was by Facebook. We were 16 years old at the time and I told her that I had a huge crush on her and that she was the reason I woke up in the morning. That she was very beautiful when she walked past me. She responded with: Awwww. That’s very sweet of you and I am flattered. But just know that you need to let it pass. We don’t know each other. I’m sorry if I hurt your feelings. I was like: Sounds good. But I was really down in the dumps after that last message. I cried for like 2 hours and was very heartbroken because that’s what a crush is supposed to do. Crush that infatuation and get you back in reality. Next day, she gave me space to move on from that crush feeling. She didn’t talk to me for 3 weeks. Then she talked to me after Thanksgiving break. She told me if I was all good and I was like: Yes, I am good now. So weeks pass and Winter Break came. During those days, I would miss her a lot. I wanted to be with her. But I kept it buried and distracted myself by going on Zombies with my friends online because I was a nerd back then. All those days I spent on Video Games, Going outside and etc. So January 9th, 2012, I came back and saw her again. I did blush a little bit but I shook it off because I wanted to be strong and not show it even though deep down, I did want to show it. But then, things started happening, she started to kinda act a little off when she around me. She would play with her hair and look at me and then when I looked, she turned the other way. I was very confused. She kept doing that for like 4 days. Fast forward to January 19th, in the last class of the day. She entered the classroom and sat down as usual. She had her group and I had mines. Of course I did my work, listened to music in my headphones as usual. Then I looked all over the classroom and see what everyone was doing, that’s when I noticed her looking at me and blushing. She told literally 5 of her friends about me and all of them started giving me looks. In my head, I was like: What is going on? So I started to kinda figure out what was going on these past weeks. I started to realize that she had a crush on me. Once I knew, I was happy and kept it to myself. January 20th 2012, she came in class and she was dolled up all the way. She had a red dress on and wore red lipstick and mascara. I was damnnn, she must be in love with me. On that day, it was a test. So I had to focus on it. But she was literally looking at me and then back at the test. After the test was done, she wanted my attention and I looked at her. She started to confess that she was in love with me and told me how she felt around me. I was so happy. I was speechless. Just so many feelings at one time. I responded: I have feelings for you too. I tried to keep my feelings in check but I coudn’t stop thinking about you. I caressed her face and she kissed me on the cheek. I had red lipstick on my left face cheek. Then the bell rang and I walked her to the next class. Later on, we hung out in the last class and walked home together, holding hands and talking to each other. We couldn’t keep our hands off each other. I was sprung as fuck hahah. We then went on 3 to 4 dates. It was fun.

Ahem ahem…okay here we go! In total I’ve confessed twice to my crushes. Luckily, both went pretty well. But, the struggle is real! Okay, the first one. So I was in love with this guy for a while. He was my best friend. I wanted to tell him but I was so scared! Naah, I’m not afraid of rejection. But, the fact that once he gets to know, things won’t ever be the same….that’s what was my fear. He kind of sensed something fishy. I had told him that I had a crush on a guy but I didn’t tell him the name. And somehow, he realized it was him. So once we were hanging out together and he randomly asked Him - “Hey, you had a crush on someone right?” Me (all awkward) - “Yeah” Him - “What’s his name?” At that moment I had two choices, either to tell him or let it go. I had been keeping it to myself for long, really long. So, I took a deep breath and said Me - “It’s you” Him (Blank) - “What?” Me - “I love you. You don’t need to love me back. It’s fine. I just wanted you to know how I feel. I hope it doesn’t affect our friendship in any way” Him - “It’s okay” He didn’t say anything. It was so awkward. Then we went home and I received a text from him. Him - “I love you too!” Oh my god! Trust me, I was dead! I was in love with him since long before I myself knew about it and him feeling the same was one of the best things ever. It was so unexpected! I never knew these simple words from the right person would feel so good. We dated for a while and later broke up. That’s an another story. Currently, we still are best friends.  The second one. So I had a random crush on this guy, nothing serious. I told my best friend about it. Oh my god, she was so excited about it! Never ever tell your best friend about your crush! NEVER! Lol. So she literally begged me to tell him. I wasn’t even sure about how I felt. And here I was, all alone standing in front of him stuck in this awkward situation. All thanks to her! Him - “She told me you had to tell something” Me - “Ummm” Her - “It’s really important. Tell him quick!” Me - “Will you shut up, ever?” Him - “Yeah I’m here, tell me.” Me - “Ummmmmm” Her - “OMG, will you?” Him - “What’s going on?” Her - “Tell him!” Ugghhh….That was a lot of pressure to handle! Me - “Okay, here it is. I think I like you” (Seriously? “Think”) Him - ……. Why do guys go blank? It’s so annoying! Her - “Say something” Him - “You know, Mansi I like you too but…” Aaah here we go! My first ever rejection! Her - “But?” Him - “Can I talk to her alone?” Her - “Uggh Okay” And here we were alone. Him - “Mansi, You’re an amazing girl and before saying anything I’d want to know you more. We aren’t close enough. I don’t want to jump into anything before getting to know you.” Me - “Hmm…fair enough” And then we started talking more and became really good friends. We used to talk every single day about nothing and everything. He eventually started to have feelings for me but by then I wasn’t into him and thus we decided to stay friends. A year later he got into a relationship with another girl. At that point I realized that I kind of still had feelings for him, but it was too late now. That’s an another story. Now, we don’t talk anymore.  So according to me, both went pretty well. What matters is that at least I have no regrets. Telling someone how you feel is one of the hardest things ever. And no matter how many times you’ve done it before, its always is hard. But, what I personally believe is that a little embarrassment is much better than a lifetime of regret. There is a time for silence. And there is a time to wait for your turn. But, if you know how you feel and you’re sure you want it then I don’t think you should ever hold back. The words that you stop yourself from saying are the ones that will haunt you the longest. So, Speak now!

Yes.. Yes.. Yes! There was this girl I came across as my classmate and I really wanted to let her know my feelings! It was 1st January, 2017 (My birthday) and I really wanted to make this day even special. Before this I thought to confess her many times but waited for the perfect day and there it was.. Here's how it goes..    Thanks for watching! :) Ignore grammar mistakes! Edit 1: Thanks for upvotes lovely people! There are a few comments asking what was her reply. I can't share the screenshot as I had saved my part only and since my phone changed, I don't have the older chats. Her reply was that she was committed since last 3–4 years or so. She felt nice that I had confessed this to her and didn't expected anything in return. She also appreciated by saying it needs courage to tell someone about their feelings. She told me I'm a nice human being and a good friend of her. I shall get someone better than her in near future. It's been more than 1.5 years. We, after this became good friends, we got placed in the same company. Having a colleague like her was best experience of lifetime. She left the organization 4 months back and got engaged to the same person she loved. I was very happy to know this. She's getting married in 2019. We are still in touch and keep sharing things like we used to! There's nothing like heartbroken feeling. We get over to things and people. Just it takes little time. Post this, I managed to be in a relationship which didn't work well. I also confessed my feelings with another girl who was my junior. Now? Waiting for next! :p

Yes! It's embarrassing, but it's fucking working. Sit down, children, and you shall hear the most awkward story of Paul Revere. So, here I am with my best friend in my freshman year of high school. For convenience, let's call her Karen. Our school has two sets of stairs near the left side of the campus, one set coming down from the main gym, the second coming off of a small exit right next to the gym. We would sit on the second set of stairs, because it has the best view of the campus's relatively forested inner landscape. It was rather beautiful, but we didn't keep it for long. The next week, a sophomore couple making out took our spot. We were slightly annoyed and yelled "get a room!" jokingly. The girl, let's call her Julia, and the guy, let's call him David, both turned to us. Julia had a permanent snooty look on her face, and accordingly sneered at us. David gave us a blank, yet focused look. He was very handsome, though. He was a dirty blonde rugby jock who I had seen a lot around. Deep, piercing blue eyes, the cutest freckles, slightly pointed canines like a sexy wolverine, with a perfect swimmer's build. Sweat-inducing description aside, the next day, they weren't there and we took the spot again. They came back later in the period and saw us; David rose his eyebrows slightly and walked on, while Julia gave her characteristic sneer and then narrowed her eyes at us. The next day, they took the larger steps coming out of the main gym for lunch. We had our spot back, so we stopped thinking about David and Julia. Freshman year passed. As eighth-graders, Karen and I had taken French I online, so we were able to be in French II during 9th grade, and now French III during 10th grade. Now, since everyone *had* to take 2 years of a language to graduate, French I and French II were artificially packed with about 30+ people, but French III was 10–25, and AP French famously had about 5 students. Our teacher, Madame, now that we had more room for everyone, liked mixing us around regularly. That's when I saw David again—-with a black eye. This is odd, but I didn't think black eyes were *actually* a phenomenon that occurred. I thought that they were primarily something portrayed on television to emphasize eye injuries and abrasions. He didn't try to hide it. Anyway, he was rather quiet and was moved from a table of attractive rugby players to a table of four, containing a nice girl named Angeline, Karen, myself, and David. Mme preferred equal gender division, hence two boys and two girls. We started chatting casually. I assumed he was some blockhead jock, but after some initial awkwardness about his black eye, wherein he explained he ran into an opposing player during some sort of drill, we started talking about the book he was reading. It was some Chomsky tome critiquing American hegemony, and we talked about geopolitical history for the rest of the period. Karen, David, and I quickly became friends, but it was obviously that they were becoming a *bit* closer. I was very jealous, but I, for one, wasn't out and wasn't going to entrust some boy I didn't know very well with my secret, and two, I initially didn't want to be a homebreaker. You might ask why Karen, and I later, didn't mind flirting with a committed guy? Well, here's the detour: Back in their early sophomore year, Julia and David began dating; like many petty high school relationships, it was primarily based on sex. Personality-wise, David found in Julia a sort of wallflower quirkiness with her own fire. Julia found a submissive jock that she could dominate. Yet, as they matured, Julia came out of her shell to emerge as a guilt-inducing dictator. Try as he might, David quickly became emotionally drained from her and subsequently fell out of love. However, she wouldn't let go, using all of her manipulative powers to keep him through guilt. So...he cheated. He cheated with two girls he was relatively close to, some rugby guys, and had a few miscellaneous hookups. You'd think that Julia would be at least a *little* angry, but, in fact, her best friend, Samantha, had started aggressively hitting on her. Julia wasn't bi, but she craved emotional attention since David started glazing over after she showed her true colors. So, Sam took all of Julia's emotional energy, so she only sustained her husk of a relationship with David through guilt and sex. At any rate, Karen and David started moving closer. She started showing me their text conversations, and I resolved myself to squash my jealousy and be a good friend and wingman. There were some problems that they had, though. David wanted a benevolent/playful dom to be his partner. Yet, he made the mistake of choosing simply *quiet* wallflowers, who were secretly abrasive, they just didn't have sufficient social power. Now, I'm really good friends with Karen, but she is too defensive and reliant on others' dominant initiative in a romantic/sexual relationship. They were deeply incompatible, but I was sublimating my feelings for David through Karen, so I put in a little elbow grease. This is the immoral tidbit. I decided to help David "develop initiative" and help Karen "be more benevolently dominant" by sending each other specific screenshots of my conversations with them. I would get David texts that showed that Karen would immediately respond as soon as he emotionally affirmed her a *little more.* I would show Karen that based on his increased affirmation, he wanted her to respond a bit more "benevolently dominant." They both took the catnip, and they vastly progressed in their relationship, so much so that their love was able to gloss over the fundamental incompatibility. Now, I knew this situation was inherently unsustainable, but I wanted them to get closure with each other first. Anyway, Karen found some screenshots of her as texts on my phone and ratted me out to David. They froze me out, but I still talked to them on an acquaintance basis. Without my stabilizing and catalyzing influence, their romantic/sexual relationship slowly iced over. They didn't really remain friends, but relapsed into civil acquaintances. I decided that I was acting immaturely by staying quiet, so I reached out to them separately, and slowly rebuilt my friendship with both of them. This was at the end of David's senior year, so, with limited time to fix anything, David and Julia utterly fell apart aside from random bouts of sex. They both left for college in different states, and, since then, I've reconnected fully with David. I was still scared to out myself to him, but during early February of this year, we happened to chance upon his gay rugby exploits in conversation, which I hadn't known about beforehand. I weighed the odds, and I decided that there was a negligible chance that he'd reveal my secret if I just told him, so I decided to just be open. It worked out, gladly. He was happy that I was open to him, but he wanted to just be friends. Yet, off and on during texts/calls/Skypes, I sensed that he was open to more. He said that he did have feelings for me, too. Over the next month or so, he flip-flopped between saying he just wanted to be friends and that he had romantic/sexual feelings for me as well whenever I asked him. It was confusing, so over this last week, I asked him in a forthright manner, and he said that he was generally just confused about the nature of his feelings due to his failed relationships, but he did want to start to engage and flirt with me, which I had been doing all along. I've asked him how he knew his feelings were legitimate. He cheated on so many people. Why wouldn't he cheat on me if we did grow closer? He replied by saying that our bond was deeper, more intellectual. He never initiated calls nor texts with anyone else, just using his looks to attract girls and guys to bombard him with offers. I chose to believe that, since I *am* a playful and exuberant andro dom and I am deeply compatible with him in various other ways. He's willing to build an LDR with me, albeit slowly, yet surely. So, that's where we're at. It's late April and my college just happens to be near enough to him so that we can meet in person every month or so. I hope we grow even closer; we have faux serious plans to go to the same grad school, but who knows? --- Also, I have to give *very*, *very*, *very*, *very*, *VERY* strong commendation and thanks to Franklin Veaux for his helpful starter advice on how to sustain a sexual spark in an LDR:

No, I never confessed. I did, however, make it very visible. I was his worst nightmare. When I was in the third or second grade, fate assigned my seat next to a blue-eyed, hazel color haired Daniel. He was witty, bubbly, and did a very good job of ignoring my crystal-clear “I like you” hints. Well, they were more than hints. I told my friend group which consisted of three girls from the same class about him. We were a strange combination and our teachers often questioned how we got along: Friend A: quiet, shy, and very considerate of not hurting anyone’s feelings Friend B: rebellious, devilish, and stylish Friend C: quiet, shy, but also not afraid to show her fierce and trouble-maker side And then there was me, the leader of this so-called group of besties. I was neither an angel nor a devil, but the planner of all our deeds. Together, we did the unthinkable. We chased Daniel and his friends during recess hours. We took glee in exhausting them and suddenly jumping away after barely grazing beside them when it was their turn to tag us. Even if their group didn’t want to play, we’d tempt them by poking or questioning their speed. “Are you scared to have a few girls beat you at racing, Daniel,” I’d innocently question. We played tag almost everyday. There were a few or many occasions where I “accidentally” bumped into Daniel or pretended like he bumped into me to have the recess staff call us out and sit down in time-out. I also took it upon myself to bother Daniel in class from passing notes to giving him the “just marry me and let’s elope to DisneyLand” looks.  I loved any opportunity to sit next to him during movie hours and to nudge him with my elbows. I would wiggle my way around the classroom library area during reading time to sit next to him. He hated it. Daniel was not even spared when I saw him in our neighborhood’s library or the local park. I remember sending my six/seven year old brother to deliver a pink note to Daniel as I looked at him from across the children’s library room. I sat, legs crossed, like a spy agent waiting for my mission to be accomplished. I also remember chasing Daniel alone in the local park until both of us were out of breath. I remember looking back to make sure he noticed how my ponytail danced behind my head as I strut off. Oh, how adorable Daniel looked when his cheeks turned pink. Basically, I was Daniel’s worst nightmare. He knew I liked him, but I never confessed. Why confess when my love was clearly indicative? Why confess when my love was as pure as this? I’m just kidding. I wish I wasn’t such a pest to Daniel even though I was only 8–9 years old. I wish I didn’t harass him so much. Had I been in his shoes, my family would’ve discussed the matter in school. Just because he’s a boy doesn't mean that he cannot be harassed by a girl. I feel terrible looking back. I don’t know what happened to Daniel, but his family ended up moving after a year or so. He was placed in a different class after that grade, and so I never interacted with him again. If I could, I’d apologize to Daniel as an adult now. But then again, I wouldn’t be surprised if he just ran away before I open my mouth to mutter anything.

For some people, this skill of human interaction comes with ease. For others, it is equivalent to climbing Mount Everest. I would say I belong to the second class of human beings. The attempt to speak out in the presence of other humans is challenging enough for an introvert. But confessing to your crush is something else entirely. It takes up all the courage you have and more often than not, slams you down into the ground. Let us learn about a few incidences in the life of this introvert. It happened during my school years. I was very close to a lady friend of mine. We would do projects together. We would chat about random topics and even participate in competitions together. Of course I had a major crush on her. I decided not to act on it as I knew very well she was dating someone else. After the end of school, we moved on to the field of Engineering. She was single at that time. I confessed that I had a major crush on her and asked her out. She said she wasn’t interested in dating at that moment and friend-zoned me. We continued to be close for an year but suddenly for some reason she severed all contact with me without even letting me know what happened. Maybe she got involved with someone else and didn’t want any connection with me. I never found closure. Of course I wasn’t going to trouble her over this and I moved on. A year later, I met someone else and there was an instant connection - literally so much in common. But I soon found out she was taken too. So I didn’t let her know my feelings. Another year went by and I met another wonderful individual. This time my heart clouded my judgement and I made the gravest mistake of my life. I told her how much I liked her and as fate would have it, she too had a boyfriend. But within a couple of months, she was single again over a trivial reason of long distance relationship (which had worked for her for 4 long years) and she wanted to give it a shot with me. Stupidly, I fell into that trap and thus began the worst couple of years of my life - with constant harassment and physical and mental abuse. After a span of two toxic years I found my freedom and since then I believe my brain is immune to crushes. That does seem far-fetched but that’s what I feel. I haven’t had any crushes in the past two years. It does seem strange when I write about it. Maybe I should get it checked. Any volunteers?

Yea, but it took me two tries to get myself to say “I like you”. 1st attempt: He was graduating 8th grade and I was in 7th so I decided it was now or never. My friends and I were looking for him and we found him walking the halls alone in his cap and gown. I told him that I needed to talk to him and all my friends ran away and watched from afar. Now it’s just us. I chickened out and instead of telling him “I like you”, I told him that I was going to miss him (although he probably didn’t know who I was up until now). I wished him luck and that I hope he’d do well in high school. I was going to say the words but tears were stinging my eyes and I couldn’t speak because there was a lump in my throat. I couldn’t hold it back anymore and just cried in front of him. I turned to walk away because I was so embarrassed. Suddenly he called my name and I was like WTHHH HE SAID MY NAME! (Lmaoo) I turned around, he had his arms open, and asked me if I wanted a hug. I kid you not my heart was malfunctioning in that moment. My brain couldn’t comprehend what was happening in those 2 seconds I was trying to process it. I stood there staring, looked at him, and I gave him a huge bear hug. I seriously didn’t want to let go. I remember burying my face in his chest and touching his back with my hands. I knew he had a girlfriend, but I didn’t care anymore. For the first and last time I hugged my crush. It was the best feeling in the world. However the real confession was made months later over text. 2nd attempt: He went to high school and rumors went around that he broke up with his girlfriend, so ME BEING ME, I decided to shoot my shot. I got in contact with him through Snapchat. I would text him constantly to the point where I was clingy af. I then asked for his number and spent hours texting him. He would always write back one word answers but I didn’t care. One day I got so confident that I was like FUCK IT. I told him that I liked him. I don’t have the texts with me anymore because I had to get over him and it involved deleting everything. It is blurry to me now, but I remembered him friend zoning me in the nicest way possible. It went along the lines of “you have potential” and that he’d rather be friends with me. Of course I kept on texting him after that but my friends told me to wait one week to see if he’d text me back. He never did, and we didn’t talk to each other after that. That was 3 years ago and I’m now in high school. We don’t go to the same high schools, we don’t text each other, and I don’t follow him anymore. It has made me glow up in a way. It has taught me how to say thank u next and learn how to love myself. I don’t regret confessing to my crush because I was able to learn from that experience.

Yes, I did and I regret it. My crush’s name is Thomas. And I have a crush on him for two years. Thomas is a handsome norwegian boy with a pair of beautiful blue eyes and his face really like this:  I started crushing on him when I met him the first time,l was a new student at his class. Thomas was sitting on his chair, smiling at me. And said:My name’s Thomas.’ ‘Ok girlll!!He’s so fuckin’ hot but it doesn’t mean you can scream and kiss him hard on the mouth.’ (really?!) That was the first thing that pop into my brain. Me and Thomas nearly became best friends and I was super happy with him on these last two years in elementary school. But things aren’t jolly when we started middle school. He barely talk to me. What happened??? I thought, my friend told me that boys want to toughen themselves to be more cooler, not getting bullied and getting a girlfriend. But Thomas talks to the other girls very much!! I ended up being very jealous and having nightmares about him and the other girls. Okay!! Time to talk about my confession to Thomas.Not a very long time after I started middle school, my class knows I have a big crush on Thomas. Everyone started convincing me to confess my feelings to him. I was soft at that time. So three months ago, in a room full of 40 people. I tell Thomas that I have a crush on him, and he said: That’s ok.’ it means:fuck no.’ In his brain. I got rejected. But luckily, my best friends rushed over to hug me and started cheering me up. After that, we never talked together, but Thomas tries to talk to me, but I said:’Stay away!I know having a crush on you is a god damn crime!’ You’re probably wondering:Why Thomas rejected you?’ Well…: 1.I am not beautiful. 2I’m from Hong Kong, not Norway. 3.I am very loud and dramatic. 4.I always cry. So now, I still love him, although he unfollowed me on IG.(hahaha) I hope me and Thomas can have a chance to be best friends again. Edit: Thomas, if you are readin’ this, I’m sorry that I love you more than friends. You can hate on me, be mad at me, be cold to me. But, S'il vous plaît. Don’t hurt me. Just what I said: Loving Thomas Lund is a god damn crime. E2: Annnd today is his birthday…I ended up writing a essay to Thomas and he did send me something afterwards.  Annnd his reaction:  * Sigh* Mamma Mia here I go again…. #Mycrushisaplayboy E3: Monsieur Thomas Lund hates me, because he takes away one of my friend’s phone without permission, I got mad and nearly kicked his balls. Annnd he block me on IG (yay) . Félicitations! Maintenant Thomas Lund te déteste très bien. (Now Thomas hate you very damn much) Can somebody tell me why I am crying now? P.S: Loving Thomas Lund is going to have consequences.  Socles JF

Yes,I can. But before I confessed to her, I confessed it to her father. Wooooh,slow down. I must tell it from the beginning. So, at in my high-school days,I was a really asocial boy who was very shy next to girls. I was never talking to girls. I was not gay per say,but since I reached my puberty,I was very shy to even talk to a girl. I spend most of my time with my friends at the dorm playing League of Legends back then. Then there was a girl in my class. I won’t spoil her name so let’s just call her “My crush”. She had brownie-blondie wavy hair and she had a beautiful smile.And her eyes…  Her eyes were just like that. Her eyes were out of this world for me. She had heterochromia,color of both of her eyes were different. Blue and green. She was a beautiful girl but like I said,I wasn’t talking to any girl back then I didn’t had anything special for her. Then one day,because I didn’t choose any extra class for the term,principal of our school forced me to select Drama classes as an extra class. And my crush was in that class too. I thought Drama classes would be very boring but I was wrong. It was really funny and I was spending a significant time with my crush in the plays we played together. At one of the plays,we were playing as pre-school kids. I was playing as a bully which was bullying other boys but was really nice and protective towards. I was bullying everyone that do bad things to her, I was even bullying the teacher. At the rehearsals of this play,she would put her legs over my legs to anger me and I would get angry and shove off her leg back. At those sequences she would smile to me with a very seductive look. It was really hard to resist. Then we started talk to each other in other classes. We would study the exams together, play some childish games stuff like that. I was really relaxed when I talked to her. I could feel that she had something towards me and my confidence was growing. I could not believe that I was able to talk to a girl comfortably. Then…  I fell in love with her. I could not talk to her after that. When I tried to talk to her, I was feeling like my tongue was stuck and could not move. I started to see her in my dreams, I wanted to talk and tell how I feel about her but I just cannot. My silly manly hormones were not allowing me to talk to her. I started to get mad and told some of my friends about my crush. They give me some courage but I still could not talk to her. Then one day, one of my friends came and said to me: “We told the inspector that you love his daughter. He is incredibly angry right now and wants to talk to you. You must go to him,if you don’t,he will beat you up.” Oh,sorry. I must talk about her father first. He was an inspector in our dorm and he was a really cool dude but I actually didn’t like him. And I was always thinked that he would do bad things to me if he heard about my feelings about her daughter. So,getting back to the story,I was like: “Is this a joke? Or is it serious? Oh my God what will I do? Ahhhhhhhh,I’m really nervous,I don’t know what to do.” My other friends joined this joke and started to motivate me with words like: “You can do this.” “It is not wrong to love.” “Say it to his face.” “You are a coward if you don’t say it.” “We thought you were a man,dude.” I was confused and afraid. I walked down the stairs and peek from door of the TV room. He was there. He saw me and I get vack immediately. I thought: “ Oh, he was looking really angry I am damned for sure.” I hesisated but with my friends’ stupid words to motivate me,I encouraged myself and walked in. There were almost 30–40 people there and all of their eyes turned to me. They were watching Survivor in TV as I could remember. I walked and sit next to the inspector. Our conversation was something like this: Inspector- Aren’t you ashamed of yourself for sitting right next to me? How do you call yourself a man? Me- *just silently looks to him* I was embarrassed. I could not even talk. He was angry. He was so angry that he started to beat me up with…  A phone charger. You heard me right,with a freaking charger. He just started to hit me the cable of the charger smiling at me. Even he was joking with me. Me- What they told you about me is the truth. Inspector- Nobody told me anything about you. I think to go away to my room and just sleep to escape this nightmare but I couldn’t. I was embarrassed and I said these magical words: “I love your daughter.” He just looked to me and said: “So what? They are joking with you,just go to sleep.” And that was it. I was angry,sad and hopeless. I just did what he said,I went to sleep. Next day after the first class, I immediately sit next to my crush and I confessed myself. I told her: “I love you”. She rejected me. After that,she learned about my stupidity against her father and never spoked to me again for almost a year. And I swear to myself to not to talk to any girl ever again. Ever! But, I was actually fooling myself. Next year we got along and she dismissed everything in the past and I realized I was still in love with her . For the last two years in my high-school life I tried get back her love and never to make her be offended by me. I never gave up. And, one day,on a beatiful summer day,I finally…  I failed. I never confessed myself to her again. I was in love with her,but I didn’t had any hope this time. It was clear to me that it was not happening. There was zero chance for me. She was knowing I still loved her but she was not into me anymore and I accepted it. And I just buried my love to my heart. Now it has been 2 years since I last saw her and I don’t know where she is or what she does nowadays. My friends told me she has a boyfriend nowadays but I don’t care anymore. I have somewhat of a mixed feelings towards her right now though I don’t really hate her. Now she is just a bitter memory in my mind. Thanks for reading this far. It might seem absurd but this was a real story. Hope you enjoyed.

Well here’s a little life hack that took me 13 years to learn: you’ll only get anywhere with your crush if you actually tell them you like them. So yes, out of 5 or so crushes I’ve had in my life, I confessed to 3 of them. For the sake of being concise, I will relate the most amusing incident. Just as a little disclaimer, I don’t normally say stuff like this. I was just in a highly pressurizing situation and kind of blurted the first thing that came to my mind. Right after I turned 16, I started liking the boy I sat next to in Calculus class. He was a senior and I was a junior at the time, so I never really saw him outside of those 90 minutes thrice a week. He was kind of like a unicorn to me; really tall (6 foot 2, if I remember correctly), really blonde, and really fascinating. We talked about anything and everything; math, yes, but also about his twin younger brothers, about our dogs, stupid things our friends had done, you name it. Our teacher assigned a project to us that we could have easily done over a few lunch periods, but I somehow convinced him that wouldn’t work and that we had to meet up outside of school. He was 18 and had a car, so he said he’d pick me up from my house and we could work on the project at Starbucks- but he failed to mention his friends, who were also in the class, would be there too. Now, his friends were all great people, but I was stuck in Starbucks with a bunch of 17 and 18 year old boys that I had largely never spoken to before. I was very nervous- dropping pencils, misplacing papers, forgetting basic trigonometry, and my fingers were shaking, which made typing torturous. I think he sensed something was off, because I had never acted like this before. After two hours, when all his friends had finished but we were still only about halfway done, he told them to go ahead and he’d stay back and drop me home when we were done. I was back to normal within an instant. We finished the project within another half an hour and were just sitting enjoying our coffee when he turned to me and said, “so, what do you want to do now?” And because I’m an actual idiot, without thinking I replied “you.” He only looked shocked for a split second before starting to laugh. “I meant if you wanted to go home now or not, but that’s good to know.” I thank my lucky stars every day that he liked me back, because if not I would never have been able to show my face in Calculus again.

So this was like a few days ago but basically me and my friend were talking about the boy I like and I really wanted to tell him I liked him. Usually when I liked a boy he would find out through someone else so I really wanted to tell this boy myself as I really like him. so I get home and I literally freak out for a solid 30 mins and was actually not going to text him. This boy that I like, he’s not really my friend but he’s in a few of my classes but him and my friend are friends. So I finally text him and I say this. ‘Hey, somethings been really bugging me lately so I’m gong to tell you. I like you. I don’t expect you to say anything but i just wanted you to know’ so I wait around 40 mins for him to reply and obviously I’m freaking out at this point as I had no clue what I was going to say and how he was going to react. So I text my friend and she’s telling me to just open the message, When I opened it all that he said was ‘aw’. One of my friends told me that it was the worst response you could get so obviously I get really upset. But I text him back with a smiley face and he texts back with a smiley face and a love heart. So I left it at that since I didn’t want anything to be awkward. Fast forward to 2 days later, I’m with my friend and I asked her to send my streaks for me as my fingers were really stiff ( it was extremely cold ). So she sends the streaks but she also goes and messages the boy I like… we have a week off from school so the reason I told him that I liked him then was because I wouldn’t see him for a week, but she goes and texts him and I didn’t really know what to say. So we were just sending each other photos and then he ignored my snap. I was probably overreacting but I got a bit upset. It’s not the greatest story but I was so proud of myself for telling him, I just wish that he felt the same for me :(

I have done it and we’re still friends. After a massive case of broken heart, I moved on from my then crush to a friend I’ve known since 1st grade. He was a friendly boy who respects my boundaries (no physical contact and no catcalling for the love of God), loves history, ASOIAF, and GoT, and most importantly responds cordially when I talk to him. His birthday is on January 6th and school started at January 10th so I figured out I could give him a gift and greeting card. I bought the gift in December along with a birthday gift for me. I bought him a Jon Snow Funko Pop and I bought myself a Margaery Tyrell one.   On the midnight of his birthday, I texted him “Happy Birthday” and he asked me how did I know. I told him I found his birthday in the elementary school yearbook (actual story). On the eve of the first day of the 2nd semester, I made a birthday card for him using some stuff I bought. I wrote “Happy (belated) Name Day” at the front with gold marker. In the right hand page inside, I wrote “May You Always Be Satisfied” with 3 different fonts. The left hand page was the most special, I wrote a heartfelt but short letter confirming my crush on him and how I want both of us to still be friends. I put the card in a customized envelope—which means there were gold smudges I made using my tips of my fingers, glued it shut, and sealed it with wax. I made sure the only thing that indicated my involvement was the “D” in the stamp. I safely put the card and figurine in my school bag and be very excited and nervous for the next day. On the fateful day, I waited until we were allowed to go home to give the things. I walked to his class and waited. I was planning to do the deed in front of my ex-crush for good measure though it didn’t happen. His class got dismissed a bit later than mine so I had few extra minutes to prepare my psyche. He went out of the door and this conversation (or at least the gist of it) happened, Me: Can we talk for a second? Crush: Sure. (we walked away from the stream of his classmates going home.) Me: (searched my bag and found the gifts) Happy birthday. I’m sorry the box is lost. Crush: It’s alright, thank you. (took the gifts and went on his merry way0 “You didn’t directly say you have a crush on him, Dea!” you might say, but I think this comes as close as I’ll ever be. He did read the letter though so yeah.

Yes, Recently. Let’s call him Adam. I met Adam through mutual friends. He went to a different school at the other end of the city we live in, and was in the year below me. We had chatted before a bit before meeting in real life with a group of our mutual friends, and from the first day I met him, I had a thing for him. So inevitably I told one of our mutual friends, and he informed me Adam felt the same, but he would be too nervous and shy to do anything. So I decided to take matters into my own hands by telling him that I liked him, and giving him the opportunity to tell me how he feels. The conversation went something like this. Me: Hey, can I tell you something? Adam: Of course. Me: I kinda like you, just thought you should hear it from me. Adam: *heart emoji* Of course I was bummed out that he didn’t tell me he felt the same way, so I took this as a sign that he had lost interest, or didn’t even like me in the first place. We kept chatting, and surprisingly it wasn’t awkward. I told our mutual friend what had happened, but he kept insisting that he liked me, and more people came forward saying that he told them he likes me. And at this point I was extremely confused! Cut to about a month and a halve after telling him I liked him, we were having one of our daily conversations when I decided to take the risk of asking him if he really likes me. Me: I was wondering if you really like me? Because people are saying that you do and honestly, I have no idea. Adam: Aha, yeah I do. Hurrah! We kept chatting for about 2 weeks, our friends trying to bully both of us into asking each other out when I finally got sick of nothing happening. Me: Hey Me: Wanna date? Me: Or something along the lines of that Adam: Sure Not my proudest moment, but we weren’t going to see each other in real life for another few weeks, and I was getting impatient. Our relationship lasted for about a month, when we decided it was best if we were just friends. And to this day he is one of my closest friends.

I have never confessed to a crush. At least not to their face. When I was in primary school (around age 6 /7) I told a friend and my friend told my crush. I am a teenager now and I’m considering confessing to my latest crush. Anyway I can however tell you what its like to hear the confession not tell it. When I was in intermediate school (around age 11/12) a guy called Matthew had a crush on me. He was very obvious about it. We had a compulsory ballroom dancing course (a whole eight weeks) and I wasn’t there the day they decided the partners. Matthew leaped at the chance to be mine. As far as I remember that was when I realized he liked me. I tried to be nice about it but there was a lot of drama. I wish I had handled it better but I was truly stupid. Lots of things happened leading up to him confronting/confessing to me. He called me his girlfriend in front of older kids at our school and I shot that down pretty quickly. Which unfortunately came across harsh. Other girls in my class told him I had a boyfriend and again I told him that was a lie. Why? I don’t know I just felt oddly guilty lying about something like that. Anyway one day outside our spanish classroom Matthew confronted me. I was literally backed against glass. He said “M you know I like you” and I have for awhile or something like that. My reply well…………. “I’m just really reserved towards my feelings towards people in my class.” Hes like “I know”. Thats the bull I came up with in the moment though. I really reserved? At last I was saved by the bell aka my spanish teacher opening the classroom door. Matthew and I had many discussions before and after that. I tried to be nice through it all but either ended up leading him on or offending him. For example he had just had braces put in and I’d remembered him only being able to have marshmallows for a treat in some class, so I put together a whole jar for him. So why shot down someone who I remembered details about and someone who was sweet, the truth is he decided he liked me but putting our names in to a compatibility test. We came in with 90% and apparently that was good enough for him. He was known for having a crush on a girl every year so I didn’t consider myself special. He didn’t like me for me he liked me because I was the only girl who wasn’t awful towards him. or intentionally awful anyway. Another reason is that there was no chemistry between us. I didn’t feel anything for him even though I thought about being with him.

It might look fictional but it’s true. I got a crush on a girl in my childhood. (Means I liked a girl and today we call that choice a crush) *hehe* We were in the same class from 1st to 3rd class , we never talked though and she got transferred. Her roll number was last in the girls section and my roll no in the boys was last.(As because the roll numbers are in serial order but roll number of girls come first, then boys.) and I remember this because I used to dream and wished that someone would say that the Last Roll number will sit together from today, which was never going to be happen and yes, it never happened. (Khuli aankhon ke lambe lambe sapne) Current scenario: I accidentally found her on Instagram, initially I was amazed whether it is she? or someone else. I decided to send a follow request , and she didn’t accept. I would like to thank Instagram for its feature that we can send messages to anyone without coming in the followers list. I send a message “ Are you the same girl whose dance was mesmerizing during childhood”.”I was your classmate once”. (She used to dance on kajraare song, back then) Yeah, it worked.. She replied very politely ‘ yeah, i am that girl ’. I was on cloud nine. The conversation was about to begin. And what she did ... She took the screenshot of my message and posted it on her story with the caption as follows and I have taken the screenshot of her story : “Thank insta …pta nhi kitne purane dosto se mulakat krwa deta h. When I was studying in 10th standard, there was a girl who live beside of my home. It's been 2 months she shifted to new house, but in 2 months I never saw her.One fine day at evening I usually go and sit near a shop in front of my house. I was reading newspaper sitting in front of shop. A beautiful girl in red dress, fair enough, dark eyes, long hair just came outside of gate beside my house. When I saw her I was like “Is she an angel”, I literally got shocked she just passed infront me and I was starring at her. I sat there for 2 hours just to see where does she stay. I got even more happy she stay beside my house. One day , when I was going to school she too came outside with her bicycle to go to school.( Her and mine schools are not same). I followed her, and got to know in which school she is studying. Next day morning, I was waiting outside my home for her to come. On bicycle we both had small conversation: Me: Hiii…. She : sorry, do I know u.. Me: no u don't, ur pen got fallen on road , so I came to give u…( It was just a way to talk with her, it was my pen, later what happened shocked me) She: ohh thank you so much and took the pen… and by the time she reached school, she went ( I was like, Mera pen to Gaya) On that day while coming back to home evening, she meet me and she returned the pen back saying “ Hey this was not mine, actually I too have same pen, I thought it is mine” . So as days passed , we became friends and I thought I should express my feelings for her. Next day. It was her birthday,, I went to rose shop, purchased 3 to 4 roses, and waiting for her to come back from school. When she came I called her on terrace: Me: Hiii, how was ur day.. She: It was super excited. Me: why what happened.. She: One of my classmate who I loved from many days, finally he proposed me. ( I was scattered from inside , and donno wat to say) Me: Ohh thats very nice.. and wish u a very happy birthday and bf.. She: where is my gift.. ( I gave her roses and I left, I was not able to see in her eyes) Me : I have some work I will meet u later… I thought that her happiness is my happiness… and I got far away from her life.. I was leaving for other city for studies, and while going I said her only one line. “ Iss naacheez ki kabi zarurat ho to yaad Karna, ye Banda hazir ho zaayega Tere liye”.. This was a small story of my first love in my life…

I have been wanting to write this answer for a while now but somehow I never got it. I had previously confessed to my crush from school but unfortunately I don't have the screenshots of that. Fast forward to second year of college, I had a crush on this guy from my class ( I had seen him before that but I didn't know who he was). I decided to take the huge step of asking him out even though he liked someone else.    At first he did tell me that he liked her but later he said that he didn't want to hurt me if we were in relationship. I couldn't handle this and I told him I didn't want to talk him. When I was 16 I was totally in love with this guy. He was 15, we worked together in a kind of teen association, we were good friends and I knew he didn’t like me, because he talked to me about the girls he liked. I liked him, a lot. And I knew he was not interested in me, but what could I do? At the same time he talked about other girls, he was the kind that make jokes, hug you, hold your hand. So one day I decided that I didn’t want to think about him anymore, and only one thing could free my heart. I needed to listen his lips telling me he didn’t want me. So I called him to my home, made him seat in front of me, and told him there was something very important and difficult to tell him. “I like you. And I know you don’t like me, I know you like [the name of the other girl]. But I need you telling me this, here and now, so I can stop picking any small things you say as a sign that we could have a relationship”. I’ve never seen so many changes in the color of other one face. He didnt’t say anything. He just hold my hands, with a very kind and moved expression in his face. There was no surprise, I knew he didn’t like me, but I just needed to do that. It was a very wise decision. I think this was my major event to overcome shyness. After this evening, I felt I could do anything. It’s something I tell anyone: make something that seems really difficult, and anything after that will seems easy. Not totally easy, but it’s the kind of thing that insuflate your heart with courage. If you have never confessed to your crush, please, do this now. To listen a “no” is no big deal, it’s something that can happens to anyone. The worst feeling is the anguish of thinking you might have worked out, just if you had the courage to tell him or her.

Yes and no. Well actually, it’s more of a no. Back in 10th grade year, I was tired of having a crush on a good friend and doing nothing about it. I decided to write a letter professing my love and give it to him the next day. On the next day, I was having second thoughts like “What if I can’t handle the rejection?” I almost decided to not give it to him at all. We were on the train going home from school and I was just sitting there just having this war with myself while he was a few seats away talking to our mutual friends. The doors opened up to my station and it was time for me to leave. But I just stood there in front of him before I finally grabbed the letter from my book bag, threw it at him, said “Text me when you read this”, and dashed out the train doors. I was so nervous while I was waiting for him to text me back. I mean, i wrote the letter really short and sweet-he should’ve texted me by now. So i texted him first telling him that I was anxious. This was how the convo went:  We go to a catholic school and there was a religion quiz on the Nicene Creed the next day. I gave my crush my homework instead of my love letter. I’m pretty sure I just told him to study for the quiz and just dropped the subject all together. But I think he knew what that paper was really supposed to be.

I had an intense crush on a fellow coursemate since the first year of university. The reactions I got from him suggested that he was interested in me too. There was once we bumped into each other like 7 days in a row when there were no lectures and including weekends. He would often smiled at me when it was just the two of us (we had totally different clique of friends). Once he even jumped up when we bumped into each other on a non-lecture day, but when our eyes met he stared into mine and smiled. I had always wondered if those were all coincidences, but anyway, as I knew he was going on work placement in the third year of university (I wasn’t), I suppressed my feelings and decided to not do anything. I told myself, it was impossible anyway. He seemed to be trying hard to control his feelings as well. The last time we saw each other was after our final exam. Someone from our cohort suggested for the whole class to take a group photo. When I reach the place where we were going to take the photo, his friends and him were already standing there prepared for the photo session. My friends and I joined in. I was too nervous to stand directly next to him so I left a gap between us. Eventually other people started filling in the space between us. I tried stealing glances at him and realised he did the same. We both did that a few times, and finally he stopped and just looked directly into my eyes. The next moment was the saddest moment I had in the last few years. He smiled at me, but I saw tears in his eyes. Fast forward a year, he left for placement and I was still at university. Sitting in the lecture halls we used to have lectures together and walking on the streets where we used to always see each other, instead of fading, my feelings became hard to ignore. It was terribly painful being stuck in a place with so many bittersweet memories. I still had final year exams to deal with, but I had to move on. So, I decided to confess. Took me a good few days to actually do it - didn’t even do it face-to-face, I just sent a text, but trust me, that moment I thought I was going to die. He did reply. He said thanks but sorry, and wished me best of luck with my exams. Although it wasn’t a positive outcome, I wasn’t disappointed. In fact, I could foresee that happening. I felt relieved. Finally. After 2 years. However, feelings are sometimes hard to control. Confessing didn’t stop me from liking him. I continued liking him for a further 3 years… but I guess, I have done my best. At least I have no regrets. I still think of him every now and then, he still has a special spot in my heart, but I can now say, I have finally moved on :)

MY INCURABLE CRUSH ( I gave this name to my story because I don't want to fall in love again ) This story is of five parts The ExposureThe AcquaintanceThe ProgressionThe complicationThe doom (It's a complete end)The Exposure. It all started over a year and 9 months ago... It is mid-September, Saturday and the time is around 17:00-17:30, the time we usually get off from school. Many people are laughing and talking around me followed by the sound of horns. There is a guy, tall, but not so hot, got good hair, admirable face, and a nice smile plastered on his face approaching towards me. I thought he was coming to me, but he met one of my classmates... I saw him until he left... And my mom came to pick me up. I went home thinking about him which never stopped. The next day, I went to school. I thought of asking about him to the girl he spoke to. Fortunately, she is absent. So, I asked my friend about her and she said that the boy I was thinking about is the boyfriend of the girl from yesterday. OKAY THEN, NEVER MIND! After a week or a fortnight, I saw him again. I was just roaming around the streets near my School with three of my friends.There is a group of people talking to a person who folded his arms across his chest and kneeling against a black bike. He is my ishk. FINE, DON'T ACT WEIRD. I passed him and my first thought was, "oh my god !why does he sound so harsh?".I turned back instinctively to find him already looking at me with those black colored eyes of his. I gasped and looked away to hide my blush that is starting to creep into my face from my neck. I never shared about him with anyone because he had a girlfriend, who is my classmate. So, NO NEVER. I even got his name. I convinced myself that it's okay, that it's just a tiny teensy crush that would go away. Because I know that I will never meet this guy. The Acquaintance. After many days... It was my first day at my new school. So, I went early and occupied myself on an empty bench. After 20 minutes, I saw a figure entering the class. When I looked up, it's him. WHAT THE FUCK!!! I can’t stay here. I sat quietly and never talked to anyone from his class. I went home in the very next period and asked my mom to shift the section. Thus, I have shifted from section A to section B. So, here comes the best part. I used to see him daily. He laughs so well for me. Maybe, I have fallen for the smile. I used to see him after every period. I’m glad that he never caught me seeing him. I used to see him from far..he never noticed me seeing at him(which I am very thankful for because who wants their first impression on their crush as a crazy creepy stalker). Continuing with this schedule. He was absent for a week. I don’t know, what happened to him. I suddenly became sad and started missing him. I missed the way he used to smile. I miss the way he used to pout whenever he doesn't understand the teacher because I’m way too attached to the way things are before. It is the best thing so far. I never dared to go and talk to him. He is finally back and I got to know that he was absent because he caught dengue. His absence wanted me to talk to him. I don’t know how to speak to him. Since we share the same school, I got his id number somehow and started seeing his results before he sees them(Totally, not creepy). His harsh voice slowly became good for me. Days passed by quickly. One fine day, I have decided to talk to him. I tried but he never made a glance at me. As being a pro at stalking, I decided to create a fake account and just to have a small conversation with him. So, the mission started. I made an account. And texted him. A message instantly popped on my chatbox who are you? what should I message him? "A girl from your class who has an insane crush on you and created a fake account just to chat with you"? Nah!doesn't sound good. So, I sent him a reply. I am someone who is fed up with everything. Would you like to be my anonymous friend? Okay, I know that I lied to him because all I wanted to have is a small conversation with the person I loved. His message came in a little while later. sure! :) It went all good for a week. We chatted daily. But, I realized that I am getting way too attached to him. so, I deleted my account. Even though I convinced myself I had enough chat with him, I was dying inside just to talk to him. So, after a week or so, I created a new account and texted him. This time, I opted for being open with him. So, I told him that I know him and confessed to him. He started flirting with me which I know is just because he wanted to know who am I. He also said sometimes stuff like how he never cares for looks and loves me internally and that I should not restrict myself talking to someone I love. He also said that I can be his new year resolution and blah blah blah. I know that he never meant a single word. After many days, I felt like it's not going anywhere. He wanted to know about me so badly. So, he proposed that we can be good friends. But, I can't be friends with someone I love. So, I sent him the most heartfelt word Goodbye… The Progression. Anamika!It is the name that he assigned to me since he doesn't know my name. I wished to remain as Anamika permanently. And then, something unusual happened. He accused me of playing with his emotions. He also went so far as to say that I am not letting him sleep peacefully ( I wished that he meant nicely because I don't want him to think of me as some chatting nightmare named Anamika who haunts him in his dreams). He even started using mobile in chemistry class so that he could receive some hints from me. Eventually, I felt terrible for him and gave him all the hints. He found me when I was wearing a coffee-colored kurthi and he was wearing a long blue-grey shirt with white jeans with black sneakers. When we locked our eyes, something weird has erupted in my stomach. I was afraid of him. I don't know how to face him when he finally knows who the mysterious chat person is or Anamika as he calls me. When he finally know me, he lost all the prior enthusiasm as I am not enough good looking for him. He barely texted me. One fine day, I was on my way to school. When I turned around, I saw him coming in my direction. I didn't realize it until then. I still don't dare to talk to him. So, I started increasing my pace. When I was about to reach the entrance, his voice startled me. "Why are you running away from me?". It was the first time that he talked to me. I stood still as I have no idea what to tell him. I could hardly see his face with my watery eyes. He repeated the question. I just shook and about to answer him but he already went past me. His tall legs made him walk quickly. I just saw him until he disappeared from my sight. I am not an introvert or an extrovert. I am an optimum type of person and I act solely based on my mood. It took me a year to text him and I continued texting him when I got to know that he was single. He broke up with the girl that I first saw him with and had another girlfriend and broke up with her too. His break up story sucks by the way. He kissed his senior. Even though it's his mistake, he never blames himself. And oh, he is still in love with his earlier girlfriend aka My classmate. I know that he and I can never happen. We are not destined together, I guess. But, he gave me the hope which I don't think I can have anymore. I felt bad as I didn't respond to him. I made it clear in my head to say sorry to him in person. So, the next day, I waited for him near the gates of the school. I reached a little early. So, I had to wait for him like an hour. When I saw him coming, My heard beat escalated too quickly. I went to the class but he didn't notice me. The next day followed the same way. I waited for him again. When I saw him coming, I developed some courage, unlike yesterday. He stopped a few steps away from me and asked, "Who are you waiting for?" "For you", I mumbled quietly. He doesn't seem to like me waiting for him as his face scrunched in anger. "I am sorry", I said quietly. He started saying something but my mind didn't register any of it as I wrapped my arms around his neck. I think he can sense my hot breath against his neck. I nuzzled at his neck and held him closely. A calm sensation has spread through me. I placed my head on his shoulder and mumbled a quiet apology. It lasted for a heartbeat. I could feel his shoulders tense with uncomfortableness with me hugging him. I let go of him immediately. He started making his way towards the school and I followed him from behind. I was not sure whether he accepted my apology or is he still mad at me. To make up for him, I spent the next two days sketching him. I am not an artist though. I waited for him at the same spot holding the sketch, chocolate, and a note that said: "I am sorry for everything". When I saw him coming, I was scared and I don't want to hug him again. I ran back to my class immediately before he could see me. I asked my courageous friend to perform the task for which she obliged. But, my heart shattered when he returns me the chocolate. I was hurt. Why can't he just throw it away? Why did he give me back? Is he allergic to almonds? Does he hate me? I already know the answer to the last one. What did he do with the sketch? I was confused by his behavior. I don't know what have I done and what to do. And then, A sudden fresh idea flicked in my tiny brain. Whenever I miss him, I started to write my feelings for him on a piece of paper and used to keep them in a bottle. I wanted him to know my feelings. So, I decided to give it to him. After a week, I was waiting for him at the same spot. I waited for more than 100 minutes since there was no one at my home anyway. When he approached me, I gave him and he thanked me. To be honest, I should be the one thanking him for accepting it. We stood there in awkward silence. I wanted to break it. So, I asked him the first question that popped into my mind. "What is your blood group?" LOL. I don't know why I asked it. I hoped for it to not be O negative. He barely texted me. He lost his complete interest on me which I assume is due to my looks. After 2-3 days, he gave me the bottle back at the same spot that I have given him before. It made me feel hurt. Why couldn't he just throw it somewhere instead of returning? He avoided me for many days and I didn't dare to approach him. Every time, I try to talk to him, he left me feeling hurt. After some days, I got a text from him. He texted me that he needs to study for his upcoming exam and said a kind of goodbye. It used to take him 2-3 days to reply to my text. And me, being me, felt a lot of hurts. It used to make me wonder about what had I done to him. I said that if he doesn't want to text me, he could just tell me and need not bother to reply to me. He instead blocked me without even a proper word or goodbye. My heart wrenched at that. I cried for days and he had no clue about the tears that never used to stop. And then, the interesting chapter of my life has started. The hacker. The Complication. The hacker is a friend of my friend. He had answers to all my questions. We eventually became friends and used to talk with each other for hours without getting bored. I started sharing everything with him including my ishk. I told him about my strong feelings towards him and how he blocked me. So, the hacker is a sweet person he is, hacked the account of the mutual friend of my Ishk and me who used to stay in some hostel. I started chatting with my Ishk as her. And the most interesting thing is he started telling about me to the hacked account. So, he started telling about me to me. He doesn't know that of course(If he does, he is the most idiotic person in the world ). He made fun of my feelings towards him and made a joke of my love for him. I came to know about all his dirty secrets. During school, I acted normal and super cool around him. I started talking to more people than usual because I don't want him to know how much he had hurt me. So, I acted so coolly around him. One day, I came to know that he has feelings for the mutual friend aka the one whose account I have been using(What a dope!). I told him that truth that It was me all along. Unsurprisingly, He was super duper angry at me. And guess what? Surprise!Surprise! He blocked me again. I deleted this account. After confessing to him that It was me, the lockdown started after 2 days. I apologized to him many times but he never accepted because accepting me implies bringing me back to his life. But the only comforting thing among all this mess was, I still had my hacker friend by my side. He said many things about ishk and not in a good way but a bad way, a very bad way so that I could forget him. But, I was still okay with that since it happened in the past. I believed him so much that I accepted everything he said about ishk. He kept on insisting to hack my ishk account but I never let him. He said that he had a very good female friend who is an expert in brainwashing people. So, he wanted the brainwasher friend of his to talk to my ishk and make him understand my feelings towards him. Her name is aakrithi and my hacker friend said many things but I never understood one and I don't know what's gonna happen because I have a very tiny brain. I apologized to him very sincerely like... Ishk... I am so deeply deeply and deeply sorry for hurting you so much. I am so sorry because I am in so in love with you and I will spend the rest of my life telling you that. I will apologize to you every day if that's what you need. I love you please talk to me If you hate me or don't want to talk to me, please say it clearly and I will never look back at you ( The Arizona apology ) He replied to me that he indeed never wanted to talk to me. The Doom it takes time to put everything in words will update soon
