Aug 1, 2018 I saw her for the first time in the office lobby waiting for the lift. She got into the same lift of mine. There were more than 25 people in the lift. It is getting stopped at almost all the floors. On one of the floor 2 were out and 4 were in. It became very compact and she came very close to me. Both of our bodies are in touch. I looked at her name in the ID card. After 15 mins In skype Me: Hi She: Hi Me: I have seen you some where before She: Probably in the lift few minutes back. Me: No, even before that. She: We share the auto from sector-20 to office. Me: Oh! Yes. I do remember. She: Mm Me: Do you have work? She: Yes Me: Shall we meet in next break. She: Yes, sharp 7pm at cafeteria near juice shop. 7pm I called her on mobile. She: wait a min, I will b there. 7:10 Both have taken juices and went out for evening walk. Me: Any boy friends? She: More than dozen Me: crushes? She: Infinite Me: Commited? She: Twice Me: Tell me current status She: Single. Me: what if someone proposes you? She: I already had a bad past, I smile and walk away. Me: My friend had seen you for the first time in the Venkateshwar Swamy temple last month and he followed you to your PG. Usually comes there in every weekend. He was there in the lift as well that day. She: I saw you so many times near my PG but I never saw any one with you. Me: Actually, I am my own friend. She: I expected. I was dumb for few seconds She: Let's go back. We started walking back She: Any Girl friends? Me: None She: Any crushes? Me: Almost every one. She: Any commitments? Me: Didn't get a chance. She: Tell me about your dreams? Me: …………..…… She: Wish you all the best. Me: Thanks She: Friends? Me: Shake hand+ blushing. I didn't take her permission to write about it. If you are reading this, I love you.

Now, this is interesting. I tried to play smart. I'll elaborate the story trying not to exaggerate but yet. If you have less time then read the highlighted content Ohkay so it was my very first year of college. After 10th getting into the 11th as a fresher. I was very excited to make new friends and there was so much enthusiasm in the environment. When the exams began, we were given our seating arrangements. By that time I had made lot of friends in college. An incident took place at that time, a boy had taken admission in our college and he was appearing for his very first exams in college, that too unprepared. He instantly became a hot topic in our college for back answering a teacher. (He had his phone with him - the teacher scolded him for it - as phones weren't permitted in the examination hall) This news came to me through my friends as I previously said he was a hot topic at that time. I wanted to see who this guy was. Well, he had a very attractive personality and that drew almost every one to him. I was very desperate to know what was so interesting about him. My friends and me were passing through the corridor and we met him past the staff room. My friends enquired about getting his phone back. They whispered to me that he was the one. For a minute I tried to initiate an eye contact with him. We exchanged looks but nothing disastrous happened lol. I came home and constantly thinking about him I couldn't figure out what was going on my mind. I thought what if I had to fall for this guy. But the only thing that was exceptional was that he had an ego issue. Huh? What'd I do? Devastate my dreams. Nah, he was just out of league. Everytime I used pass by him and each day made me fall for him. This was very incomprehensible. This month was filled with college activities and the college came up with the fashion show 2017-2018. Me and my squad were now a part of this. To my surprise! I was astonished! (He was a commerce student - we were science students) inspire of that he somehow joined our group. I was utterly flabbergasted and didn't know where I was jumping out of happiness. I was so overwhelmed. With God's grace I was his partner. During our rehearsals I had to hold hands and dance. I was on cloud nine. But the only difference was that he and me would never talk. He was cool with everyone but not with me. Days passed and I started taking to him. We shared many secrets and our life stories. I made up a story of my previous crush and told him that I had a crush on a guy. Since 4 years but he's out of my league. What advice would you give me? We talked about this for like 2-3 weeks. Still the atmosphere was cold. I wasn't sure whether I should confess that the guy I had a crush on was none other than him. One day I made up my mind. By that time he had broken up with his girlfriend and was into a new relationship. He was a very good personality except for his ego though. Almost the juniors and seniors, everyone had a crush on him. I thought I must leave this. But something cane up in my mind and I thought I should tell him. I texted him and asked him whether I should tell him. The conversation was something like this. Previous night day 1- Me : Hey, I'm not sure what to do? I can't sleep. Him : Hey, why what's the problem? Me : Should I confess it to my crush? I can't hide this anymore. Him : Yes, indeed you should. Why don't you tell him? Me : I'm afraid so he won't accept me. Him : Why do even think like it? What is more important is that you must confess what's in your mind. Confessing your feelings is more important. He must know what you feel for him. Me : Ohkay cool then I'll tell him. Day 2 Me : Hey, actually I'm ready to tell my crush about the truth. Wish me good luck. Him : Yeah, sure go for it. Me : Actually, I lied. Its none other than you. I have a crush on you. Him : *astonished What? Why didn't you tell me first? Me : It's alright. I'm sorry. Him : Yes, let it be. I had to face him many a times in college but I always had to break my heart. Things never worked out well and we don't talk anymore. Cause we made it way too awkward and we wouldn't fix it. I told you previously right? He had ego issues. He had many girlfriends but then it never worked with me. Only to realise he wasn't worth the time, love and patience. Conclusion : Never fall for someone based on thier looks, it isn't necessary they have a good heart always that will nurture your feelings. Crushes are better crushes. Don't love them to the extent that you will break yourself. You shouldn't waste time feeding them with ego. If they're worth it, they will never put you down. If it doesn't work then you must move on. There are more than 7.5 billion people in the world. You're destined to the right person. Don't rush anything.

Let me tell you my story of finding a girl I liked in college. I was in my 2nd year of Engg. when Diploma students joined our class. I wasn’t much studious back then. I am an introvert who likes to spend time watching movies, tv shows, play games, read novels, etc. I am mostly on my own and don’t like much company. So, Diploma students joined and luckily I attended the first lecture with them. My attendance normally was 50%. And in that lecture I saw HER. She looked very simple, no make up, sincere, hard working, focused, studious and someone that just was a duplicate of the ‘ideal’ girl I would like to marry. She was all the above things I mentioned and I fell for her, real bad. She didn’t drink, smoke or do drugs like me. I couldn’t resist, so I started talking to her. My approach was to let her know that I liked her and let her make any moves if she was interested. I talked to my friends about her, they thought she was an “Innocent” person. I asked my friends because I have seen many girls in the above 6 types and I was afraid of how they hurt men’s feelings and just don’t care and maybe same could happen with me. But, I got my validation from others and everything was good. I am not sure when she knew that I liked her. But, her behavior was same throughout the semester and I was shy and used to talk to her kindly. But no one told me I was naive when it came to girls. I knew I was inexperienced with girls. I had respect for her so I tried never to make her uncomfortable. I never had any sexual thoughts about her, only that I wanted to spend time with her. I got her number and tried to make conversations either via Whatsapp or through talking but she didn’t ask me questions back. She only used to answer my questions, that’s it. As I was inexperienced I asked my friends, they said it is normal ‘Girls take time, maybe she is taking hers.’ She used to give me smiles and I used to think she is my friend or maybe she likes me. But, I wanted to be sure. So, I asked her if she could teach me a topic in the library because she was great in academics. She denied. I thought she doesn’t like me so I gave up the chase after 1 or 2 more tries. But, then she used to look at me in class. Her and her friends’ behavior used to change when I crossed paths with her in college. I ignored all of it. My best friend(a guy) told me to find out if she likes me through her close friends or friends in class. So, I was nice to everyone in her friends group and even others whom she used to talk to. I became friends with a girl in her group(g1) and suddenly after a month with a friendship with her, g1 stopped talking to me. No explanation, nothing. I got confused as to why g1 wasn’t talking to me, maybe I did something wrong. But I couldn’t find my mistake, because I didn’t do any which I realised later. I got confused and irritated about g1’s and my crush’s group friends giving me such different treatment. They used to not say anything just look at me with no expression. They stopped talking whenever I used to cross paths. Then, I asked myself “Am I a stalker? Did I over do it?” But, it wasn’t the case because I needed only one look at her in a week and I was satisfied. I texted her for 2 months in the start that too once a week. I was sure I did not do anything to bother her. If she wasn’t interested then why smile at me? Why her friends look at me this way? Why she would turn and look at me during classes? So many questions flooded my mind so I thought to give 1 more try. New Semester began. I tried to talk to her 2–3 times and she was normal. But still she looked at me in class. My best friend convinced me something is going on. You should confront her. Ask her what this is. That’s it I decided to call her. I called her and told her how I felt. I asked her if she wants to know me, if she likes me, if she would like some time to know me. She repeatedly said- “It is not like that. I just like you as a friend.” I got my answer, I was satisfied. I was relieved, knew now that she wasn’t interested and it is finally time to give up. I never attempted anything to impress her after that. But she keeps doing these things again and again like smiling, her friends looking at me, whenever I am near she talks loudly, etc. I now just ignore all of this. Most of my friends now tell me it was all for attention and filling her ego. But I always thought she was a kind person. If someone had told me if they had a crush on me and I did not like them I would have told them- “It’s okay. We can be friends. If you need something you can come to me. But I do not feel the same way. I am sorry.” I expected something like this back then but I don’t now as she doesn’t care about me in any way. I accept that she doesn’t owe me anything and although she didn’t say any of this, it made me more sure that she wasn’t the person who I thought her to be.

Yes. When I was a thirteen year old freshman in high school,I met this real cute girl in Spanish One class. From the first day I saw her, I started crushing on her, but I remained silent. I was shy and awkward around girls back then. This crush remained all through high school and not one time did I tell her how I felt. I would see her in the halls, in the cafeteria, at football games, and in the neighborhood. She had no idea of what I was feeling. We graduated and went our separate ways. I would see her in the streets from time to time and we would go down Memory Lane, laugh and talk then go our separate ways once more. Years went by, we met other people and had children, broke up with those other people and kept on going. One day I am walking down the street and saw her talking to another younger woman who was her niece. My first impulse was to keep on walking, I mean ten years had passed since I saw her last and I didn’t think that we had anything to say. I walked right past her, but I got this vibe and it told me to go back. Talk to her and play catch up. Ya know?? I went back and surprised her. I was talking to both her and niece when I playfully told the niece that back in the day I had a crush on her aunt. The look on my ex-crush’s face was sheer shock, but she got it together real quick and started laughing. I was on my lunch break and had to get back to work. She gave me her phone number and I gave her mine. Even though I put her number in my phone, I had no intention of calling her. I mean those feelings were long ago and we had both moved on with our lives. Two weeks pass and she calls me out of the blue, the call was so pleasant that we started exchanging phone calls. A month went by and we had a first date, which lead to a second and a third and so on. One night on a dinner date, she blew me out of the water with a stunning revelation. She told me that me that she was crushing on me all through high school as well, but she never said anything or made any kind of move. What you have to remember was back then girls and women rarely made the first move. That is the way it was. Nowadays girls and women are more secure in going after a man that they like and that is so damn refreshing. We have been together for the last ten years and chances are we will be together for the next ten. We have so much fun together,share things together and our sex lives are damn good as well. (Yeah, older folks are still doing it at our ages). So yeah…..It turned out okay!! (lol)

response.answer_text: Oh yes, I did, and not just once, but several times. And trust me when I say this, every time I got rejected :’D. Coming to the latest or last one, she is currently a batchmate of mine. We were in the same section for the past year, and I had a crush on her from the day one I saw her. So I had decided that I’ll tell her when we will be in Singapore. I had to wait for the opportunity, for like almost a year. And had to make it special, so Singapore was the perfect spot for it. Coming to the Judgement Day, it was our last day in Singapore. I had decided I will confess my feelings but somehow had a change of heart. Here a few friends of my persuaded me to do so as this was once in a lifetime opportunity and then we had our summer break. And so I got convinced. We were at the Marina Bay Sands Casino as we had planned to spend the last night in Casino, but due to the latest change of heart I had, I had to go back to NTU. So a friend booked a cab (as it was past midnight the public transport was off), reached the campus by around 2:45 am. For some reason, my data network was not working, so when I reached back, connected to the campus’ wi-fi, pinged her to meet me. I can clearly remember how I spent the next 20 minutes - it was like an eternity. I can still feel how my mind started thinking of every negative outcome that was theoretically possible until she replied. The moment, her message came, my body went numb. Somehow I brought myself together and then asked her to meet me outside the building as I wanted to talk to her about something important and she agreed. I rushed down, went outside and sat on the ground. My hands were terribly shaking, and I could clearly feel the chilled air in the campus. And a few minutes later, she came. God, she looked so amazing! I went speechless for a few seconds. So then she asked me what did you want to talk about. I told her everything, how I felt for her from the first time I saw her, how I had noticed every little detail about her, and all I could remember. I spoke for like 30 minutes at a stretch. My heartbeat for sure was off the charts, my hands were shaking like anything and all this while I couldn’t gather the courage to look into her eyes even once. After this, she spoke and said she was happy that I told her directly, but there was nothing from her side. She hoped and asked if this doesn’t change our friendship and I replied it won’t. Then, at around 4:00 am she said let’s go back to our respective rooms. I was still shaking and told her I’ll take some time, but she asked me to go back. I couldn’t say no to her, and we went back. So this was my story.

I did……but most of anything at all,it felt relieving. I used to go to coaching classes and she came there too .It was after my boards that i thought “why not do something i’ve never done before?”. I used to sit in the front row and watch her everyday.Sometimes,i would find opportunities to try and squeeze between her two friends when they used to sit near the blackboard and sit next to her (the oldest trick in the book to get acquainted). She was very average looking,infact below average compared to other girls in the class but she kinda looked cute to,and that was the biggest turn on for me,so i went for her straightaway. We used to talk in class,outside in the canteen,even on whataspp latenight.I felt like we even had a moment in the washroom when she texted me to come over there but i could’nt understand her indication.We talked a bit,I drank water,then i left.The studious dumb fuck i was;D. Then came the D-Day,Our entrances were over and she wasn’t coming for some days,so i decided to enquire. Finally i came to know that her dad had asked her to stop coming to classes as she was preparing to go off to college. So i decided to break the ice to her…… remember ,the begining is always the hardest… But i kept stalling,nd stalling nd stalling forever………. Then i finally blurted out the truth…….with a little bite of philosophy and personal thoughts…. you guys might be wondering,so what did she said???? Are ruko zara ,abhi thoda maza to lelo…….. Even she is shocked how can I fall for her when when we had almost zero interaction …….nd even i was’nt sure excatly when i fell for her XD. …….. .nm,shy guys do that……i think.When i thought,enough blabbering,it’s time to elaborate, fir to launda jo form me aaya hai na,kasam se.Poore 12 saal ki english eak jhatke me jhaad di. Nd seriously,i did’nt even gave a fuck about what she had to say.;D.It’s like u studied ur ass off for the exam,nd don’t care about the result…….. dekho chutiya fir se padhai pe aa gaya…..#@#@@ When she realized it’s time to respond,she replied with an equally lengthy answer.Maybe to not make me feel bad……… It was sweet and truthful,but really i don’t wanna believe the last thing in her first reply…….. aise to ladki kabhi nhi milegi mujhe.XD.M still trying to work it out tho……..but sab bekar tha ab….Appy (cold drink) bc?!?!?!??! I would still get her one tho..;) Ohhhh bc!!! now i understood what’s going on.She’s already taken XD.But the bigger idiocy — I knew that already but still went on for her. Alag hi level ki sakthi dekh rhe ho? Now that i started to look like a crybaby,she tried reassuring me by sugarcoating her words.. Hatts of to her for that…… ignore my last texts,even i don’t have an explanation for that.  Seriously i loved her gesture , asking me if had food or not :)But i hated myself for not giving attention to these feeling nd all too……… warna itni care karne wali gf mil jati mujhe XD. then she sent me pics of her man…….. guitar can really make a guy look cooler no??? Nm even i thought that he was goodlooking and handsome.She was clearly out of my league…..However,when i met that guy a few days later at an event,where she also had come,i literally cringed at her choice.He was nothing like his pictures…… crooked teeth,shabby hair,very yokelish way of talking with no strict ambition in life.I asked him his instagram id and checked out he looked cooler in that too,but i had seen him today, nothing similar to what he appeared on his photos. Then later i wondered,……. maybe if I had met her earlier then something was possible.But then i realized,it’s not about opportunities,when you don’t have the sufficient skills in that particular field,then nothing would work out.Maybe that’s what the other guy had that i lacked…….. Even though I was clearly ahead of that other guy :) Edit 1 : Thanks a lot people for such a positive response at my sob story , didn’t expect that .I haven’t heard from her since then and don’t know where she is currently.Sources tell me she’s pursuing college in Noida where she is in regular touch with her bf. Good for her :) . Also,guys do tell me how you felt about my little confession story.

Yes and no. Alright. So over the summer my church’s youth group has a week long retreat where we worship, play games, stay up late, eat junk food and have the option to compete in a music competition (Which I did and won first place that year.) My crush, who goes to my church, was also coming (His family is often very involved in the retreat.) So it was the second last day, and myself, some of my friends, my crush and a couple of his friends were all at the playground. Now, I had recently confessed to my boy-crazy friend (We’ll call her Lauren). Now Lauren has a crush on a new person every day. She goes in between guys, talks about them non stop, talks to them non stop, so once she’s crushing on someone new pretty much everyone figures it out within the first few hours. I hadn't realized telling Lauren was a mistake until this happened. Okay, so we were all at the playground, chilling out we had some free time before dinner. I have my ukulele, I’m singing and playing along. Lauren grabs my arm and whispers in my ear, “(We’ll call him Aiden)- Aiden needs to hear you sing, we’ll see if he likes you!” So she drags me over to my crush, says, “Hey, Aiden! Morgan has a song for you!” He’s a very polite and caring person, so he listens well I do the song again, my face probably a shade of scarlet, my hands trembling out of embarrassment. When I’ve finished, Lauren goes, “Soooooo, Aiden, did you like it?” He blushes slightly and responds, “Yeah.” Lauren gasps and grabs my arm again. I tell Lauren we should go and just turn around to leave when Lauren shouts to my crush- “AIDENNNN!!! MORGAN LIKES YOOUUUU!” I stop in my tracks and turn around, ukulele in hand, pick in the other, thoughts twisting around each other in my mind. I didn’t want him to find out, ever. (All my friends had kept shipping us without knowing I liked him, saying he liked me etc but I didn’t want to do anything until I got the situation under control, if at all.) My crush goes red. He’s obviously uncomfortable, and I don’t blame him. I curse under my breathe yell “Bye, Aiden!” over my shoulder, and drag Lauren back to our cabin, where I can demand an explanation out of her. Since then, I’ve purposefully been staying away from my crush. Like I said, I didn’t want him to find out. Though recently, I caught him staring at me and he gave he world’s sweetest smile, so I don’t know what’s really going on. Curse you, Lauren. :)

I have had a lot of crushes since my school days but I confessed to only one of them. She is my best friend now, it lasted for exactly 2.5 years. I met her in school in year 2011, and that's when it started. We used attend the same school, same tutions and so were aiming for the same exam. One I posted a joke related to crushes, and then she asked “who is your crush btw?” And 10 days later, 26th May 2014 was the time came, when I told her. I was always tensed because I already had a exam that day. I confessed her over text. It was 7.00 PM in the evening and every second felt like an hour, and then I said, “you're my crush” and at that moment of time, powercut occured (a typical problem of India) and the weather was bad, there were thunderstorms, wind was blowing fast and suddenly my mobile network was gone!!!. It was like a heart attack to me, because I was waiting for her reply and there was no internet. But after a little more time, internet came back and her reply too. It was a “NO”. The reply was more dangerous that thunder shock. I was sad that day and it continued for 2–3 months, but as the time passed we became good friends and she's my best friend now. And, now I believe whatever happened was good. Before that incident I never actually talked to her, we were just classmates and not even friends and after that things changed and changed for good, she is my best friend now. Things are going good. It was a freaking experience in short term, but a good one in long term. Source : Utkarsh Nirbhay (उत्कर्ष निर्भय)

I have and it didn't go so great (I was expecting it to go like this). So long story short a new girl came to our school. I won't say her name incase she is reading this but let's call her 'A'. So her friends called me to the table at lunch and told me that a Pakistani girl joined. I was pretty happy because you don't get many fellow Pakistanis where I live. So then she came and man her eyes and smile intoxicated me! I could stare in them for eternity. The first conversation went like this. Me: You Pakistani? A: Yeah Me: Tum Urdu Bolti ho (U speak Urdu?) A: Yeah I can understand it And etc. I tried making small talk and that but let's keep the answer short. I always dreamt of her for days and I was trying to comprehend my thoughts. When I realized she was in my maths class I was over the moon. Those days were awesome. I would try and get to know her and we always smiled at each other. She was always in my mind and then I asked my friend for help on how to approach her. Then she found out somehow and I was pretty pissed but I wanted her to hear it from me. The problem was there was a huge crowd watching and this was not well planned at all. I had no choice and this was my first time confessing. I swear her eyes seems to flash. It went something like this… Me: Mai jaanta hun ke tum yeh jaanti ho lekin mai kehna chahta hun ke mai tumse boht pasand karti hun (I know you know this but I want to say I like you a lot). I don't care if you don't like me but I just want an honest answer. A: You are a great guy and you will find a great girl one day but I don't date. Me: It's fine but I don't want to date cus we are Muslims. I just want to get to know you as a person. A: I get what you mean. So I thanked her for her honesty and have come to terms that she doesn't like me and I respect that. Her eyes and smile is always on my mind <3. But I guess we weren't meant to be. Allah has something better for me.

Well this is backwards, iit's her admitting to me. DISCLAIMER: This series of events took place before i met my current girlfriend. (The above disclaimer was intended purely for my girlfriend in case she goes snooping around my Quora answers. Yes, I see what you're doing. I'm doing this for my protection.) So… A little while ago, I was working at a restaurant and I was out of boot camp for about a year and a half at this point. I didnt make this known to anyone. My manager (who is also my old man) approaches me with a girl- “Hey, this is the new girl. Her name is Riley.” (Her name wasn't really Riley, but for the sake of identity protection we will call her Riley) So Riley was kinda shy but otherwise bright and seemingly personable. “Roger that" I say to my manager, who walks away to do manager stuff. So I give her the breakdown, I tell her what's what and I give her what she should do and shouldn't do, the whole shebang. Since I'm pretty much in charge of the servers and my managers closest advisor, I become the primary point of contact for all servers in here. “Okay so that's what we do. I'm gonna give you my cell phone number, call or text any time of day if you have questions or requests.” So I give her my cell phone number. She rapidly accepts. I train her up and I walk her through the complicated shit. One week later… So Riley is pretty much fully trained up and she can handle a few tables on her own. She's texted me a few times asking for clarification, the usual stuff. It's not until next week she starts getting familiar with the staff. Next week… At this point everyone knows Riley and everyone likes her. Shes pretty cool and likes to giggle. A picture perfect server if I've ever seen one. One day she asks me to give her a ride home. Granted, I wasn't working this day but I live less than 5 minutes away, so I said okay and went. She closed today, so she was already waiting for me by the time I rolled up. She happily skips to my car, and says thank you probably about 183 times (that's an exaggerated number, but you get what I mean). So she explained. Apparently something funky went wrong with her shit-mobile (1999 Honda Civic I think it was) and her engine started to misfire. No worries, I'm not getting bent out of shape. I offered her a ride in to work tomorrow. I opened at 10, but she was scheduled at 12. She accepted, knowing she would be going in at 10 instead of 12. Roger that. The day when I took her to work… So I wake up around 6. Do my morning run, eat a hearty, yet healthy, breakfast, and be ready to rock and roll on a moment's notice by so I get 3 whole hours to myself. I'm lovin' it (McDonalds pun intended). Then Riley texts me asking what time I would arrive. I told her around 9:30. I forgot I was taking her to work. So make that 2 hours to myself.9 rolls around faster than I could blink, and I'm on the road and rolling to her house. I'm there at 9:20, exactly 10 minutes before my initial reply of 9:30 (thank you, Army). She busts out of her house with her bag of makeup (I think?) And rushes to my car. She was obviously in a hurry. “Okay let's go" she says rapidly. “woah now, relax. It's only a 10 minute ride to work, and I'm here early. You can do what you gotta do.” I reply. She halts in her tracks, then looks at the time. She sighs in relief. She must have thought she was running late. So with my permission, she proceeds to finish her makeup in my car while I play a game on my cell phone. Then she says… “I bet your girlfriend does her makeup in your car a lot.” I knew exactly why she said this, but I was gonna play her game. “uh, well, heh, I dont have a girlfriend.” (DISCLAIMER: THIS WAS MUCH BEFORE I MET MY CURRENT GIRLFRIEND) She looks at me and tries to make a shocked looking face, but I knew she was trying to confirm her suspicions. She apologizes for assuming, and finishes her makeup. She gives me the go, as I take my car off neutral (yes it's a manual) and go for the road.We arrive at work by 9:45. I have this whole restaurant opened and ready for business by 10:20. The kitchen opens up at 11, so my table service doesn't start until 11. So, to kill the time, I find a nice corner and play that game on my cell phone. Riley approaches my little corner and sits next to me after she is done with her stuff. “I really appreciate you giving me a ride in.” she says, practically hugging me. Slightly squeezing me. “No worries. Do you need a ride home?” I reply. She smiles and tries to cover up her obnoxious blushing. I'm not doing this on purpose, for the record. Eventually she kindly declined, saying her mom is already coming to get her. So after that we had a busy day. It was just me and her all day until 8. I helped her out when she was in the weeds, it was a good day. I stayed behind and let her go home before me because she was gassed out. Two more weeks later… Manager tells me we need to do the dreaded cleaning day this Sunday (normally we close on sundays) and he offered to come in. Riley was off today and I was on a double with another server. I took him up on his offer as it would just be him and I doing the cleaning. Saturday night… Riley and I are on a double once again. We are just finishing up a slow, ass-dragging day and we were authorized to start breaking down 10 minutes to 8. Awesome. I waste no time and start breaking down. Manager leaves for the night. “So, what are you doing tomorrow?” Riley asks. “Well, I'm coming in with Jim tomorrow to clean the restaurant. So I'll be pretty tied up.” “Just you and Jim?” she asks. “Roger that.” I reply. “If you dont mind, I can come in and help out.” I told her I would consult with my old man, but it was almost guaranteed she would be able to come. So, I got home, I asked, and he says- “Psh, you got help so I can stay home!” Jim says. It's exactly what I expected him to say. “Just clock in under manager when you get there" (it's an $11 difference in pay). Roger that sir!!! So I do the thing and I tell Riley. It would just be the two of us. I told her she should wear clothes she doesn't like, or doesn't mind getting dirty. “ok :)” she replied. Sunday… I get there early as usual and I get everything set up so when she gets here, we can start. Its 8AM at this moment, so I just sat at a table and kicked my feet onto another chair and played that game on my cell phone. I dressed in black cargo shorts and an old Under Armour tshirt. No big deal. Riley arrives at 8:15 and she assumes that since I am there before her that she is super late. No biggie. Shes in with “jeggings" (or so she calls them) and an old tshirt of a band called Sleeping with Sirens. I'm not sure if that is her taste in music, but whatever. I close out of my game and task her with the following objectives- “Alrighty so you just do that little area by the bar and I'll do this area by the soda machine and we'll work our way around the place. Word?” She says, “I was thinking we could knock out bigger sections together so we can do the whole restaurant in one go.” I’m not about to argue with a female. So I agree. We do the cleaning thing and we make quick and steadfast progress. Although I caught her eyeballing me a couple of times. I knew what was going on, but I know better than to be the one to ask about it. 2:00PM rolls around and I told her we could go on a little lunch break. She happily accepted. So we ran a seafood restaurant, and the market here was pretty nifty, outfitted with all the latest tech and stocked with all kinds of fish, like black grouper, Scottish salmon, Cobia, tripletail, you name it. So I got authorization to use the kitchen. Fuck yes. “So what are you hungry for? I'll cook you something to eat.” I offer. She does more blushing than deciding, but eventually goes with Salmon. I'm doing some sexy, sexy Cobia. So I turn on the gas and appliances and I get to work. She sits right at the pass and watches me do the whole thing. Kind of a weird feeling being watched. “thanks for cooking, it means a lot.” Riley admits. “No problem. Just doing what I do.” She stood silent for a few minutes while I break out some seasonings and vegetables, and cleaning up as I go. “So you really dont have a girlfriend?” she wonders. “Yeah, I'm pretty sure. Unless some weirdo is running around telling people that I do.” Riley giggles. I serve her a Salmon A La Carte, complete with wilted spinach, seasoned seaweed, and fennel coleslaw and frisee garnish on the Salmon. I think at this point I won her heart without even trying. My own plate was a few minutes longer, but she didnt start eating until I was ready. She was brought up the right way. So we just talked and talked about bullshit and how the world should be and whatnot. Until… “I think I like you. No, I know I like you. I really like you.” Then before I even open my mouth, she starts firing. “I thought you were cute when I first met you, and I was so glad I had your number. I didnt think we would work together as often as we have been, but I was really happy that we did. I learned so much about you so soon, and I knew then that I liked you.” She said a lot more than this, but i didn't want to overflow your screen with Riley pouring her heart out. It took a good 10 minutes. I didnt really react. As usual. I was speechless, namely because she fired so fast I was having trouble keeping up. So I muster up some stones and reply. You know, the usual ‘I'm glad we like each other' bit. So with a small hint of awkwardness but otherwise normal atmosphere, we finished up cleaning. It takes the rest of the day and we get out by 7. (I promise this answer is almost done) So I punch out and she does the same and we meet each other out back after closing the place down. With no words whatsoever, she hugs me. It scares the shit out of me since I didnt see it coming, figuratively and literally. She softly giggles at my reaction. The turns me around and the only thing she says was a small apology as she moved to kiss me. (REPEAT DISCLAIMER: THIS WAS BEFORE I MET MY CURRENT GIRLFRIEND) I'm just trying to cover my ass ^ I tasted cotton candy chapstick after I recovered from my initial shock. What the fuuuuck is up with this?That encounter lasted about a good half hour before we went home, and I spent the whole night trying to answer my own questions. It was super weird, because chiefly it came out of nowhere, but I didnt really mind.Riley left recently to move to Kansas after about 8 more months of working here. If you were wondering, she didnt kiss me again. We did hang out some days. We still keep in touch. That is all. Carry on.

Yes I have. In fact, I confessed yesterday through text since it was the last day of school. I started the confession with a picture of cheese with a caption of: “I am going to start with some cheddar.” The end result was that she responded with that she saw me as more of a friend. I responded by thanking her for responding. This was due to I guess, in a way, giving me closure to my feelings for her, regardless of how heartbroken I was. Nonetheless, I had already decided to respect the response regardless of the result and I went through with it. Then, I ended the confession by saying to have a great summer and best of luck in college. I will be honest, this was the first time I ever confessed to my crush and despite the heart break, I still felt relieved in a way because I actually was able to go through confession in general and express my feelings to my crush since I am usually timid and I feel like this was a big step to a certain extent. Granted, I could have done this in person, but my only opportunity left was graduation and I started overthinking and decided to leave graduation early after the ceremony was over without the reception. In hindsight, I feel that if I confessed in person, it would make me even more nervous and possibly back out at the last second. Overall, I am glad I confessed because it gave a new experience whether it would be positive or negative, it was new. I still have lingering feelings, but over time, I will continue to move forward and persevere without the lingering feelings or making things awkward. To conclude this answer, I added the picture of cheese in the beginning because I thought that no matter what the result of my confession was going to be, I could say that the confession was … CHEESY…

Yes I have! I have only crushed on two girls in my entire life. I have been brutally rejected when I did. I'm 23 by the way. And Crush #1 had been my crush for several years but I wasn't brave. This is how it all went down: Me: I was gonna say it over the phone, ideally would have rather said it in person and honestly I was struggling to get into position to shoot my shot. Over text feels kinda like a timid move. ( And increases the overall risk of death by receipts lol ) I hide behind jokes, yes I realize that but okay... I really like you. I'd still rather tell you in person though :) Crush #1: Okay, first of all thank you for telling me. I don't think it's easy being transparent like this. I also don't think I would have guessed it tbh. Crush #1: Secondly, I don't want to be labeled the "friend-zoning" girl. But I'm going to be honest and say that you're my really good friend. Which is not something I would have expected anyway. And I genuinely do appreciate you as that. So, this is where I stand with you. Me: Okay, thanks for your honesty. I was mentally prepared for this moment, but somehow it did not make it any easier. One last question, is there hope for me or am I just holding on to a lit candle in the wind here? Crush #1: Honestly, it's the candle bit. The only relationship I see you and I in is a healthy friendship, if that's cool with you. If not, then I respect whatever decision you take from here on tbh. Me: It feels like my mind just stopped working, I don't have a crafty comeback. Thanks again. Crush #1: Hmm. That's cool too. Take your time. I was heartbroken, but I think it was worth it. It gave me the courage to try and start looking elsewhere for love. After a few weeks I went after Crush #2. This time I was gonna go for the direct approach and start in the DMs with my intentions straight up. And this is how it went down: Crush #2: Lol nice to meet you too. Lol How old are you? Me: I'm 23.. I was about to ask - how about you then I realized it's in your bio ... You're 22 right? Crush #2: Haha yeah, Your dp is deceiving you look really young. Me: Haha I get that a lot and actually have a lot of funny stories because of it .... Which I would gladly tell you over ice cream one of these days. Crush #2: You're so slick its unbelievable. I should tell you now that I have a boyfriend. My hopes and dreams were crushed. I would try to sweet talk her into a date over the phone. Just when I thought I was winning, she blocked my phone number. Haha, jokes on me. Heartbreak once again. Maybe I have the worst of luck but I have tried to follow the advice of Sean Kernan and Gordon Miller time and again. I hope it helps someday. Now I struggle. I have tried dating girls who I have no emotional attachment to. It's a waste of time and I advise the reader of this answer to cease and desist such behavior. It only hurts the other person. I'll stay single for now. Maybe one day I will meet someone who feels the same about me as I do about them. In the meantime, I will write on Quora and hope I get upvotes for my most sincere answers, like this one! The upvotes will mend my broken heart. :D Thank you for reading.

I know, this answer may get lost in these ‘100+' answers, but still even after 4 years, I have a lot to say about the only one crush I have ever had in my life!! It all started in my 9th standard, when I entered to a new school van, there was that boy who was friendly with every one, whom even made me to talk( I say this with a lot of excitement, because I had been a introvert, lol!!) And he had been my senior, okay now, time passed, I started falling for him, I started to feel a different feeling while seeing him, I gradually got to know I was happy near him, and I am growing a liking for him, it was really weird to cop up with those feelings, I knew I cannot confess this to someone else. And you can understand repeatedly seeing your crush will not give you a chance to forget him!! Now, after about 7 months of this incident I accidentally got a chance to talk to him, and I understood, he is committed and is on thw way to see her, yeah, I felt like I am drawning to hell, I simply gave him a smile after hearing it, and lol!! I was going to confess my love for him, that would have made an earthquake there!! Now, I studied, passed with a well good marks in my 10th boards (90+) and I moved on to another school, I thought this was the only way I can forget him, I suppose, I was so much in love with him that, I used to think about him each and every minute of my day, actually I was mad with his memories…..I told my new friends about my failed crush, when I was in 12th, my friend started a new insta account , so my friend searched for him in it, and found his blogs…!! Actually the day she told me about his blogs was a heavenly day for me, since, his blog was all about his breakup, I know it must be hard to have gone through that situation, And finding happiness in someone's sorrow is bad, but, I felt like I was the most happiest one, I felt like hgging and kissing my friend. Now fast forward, oneday I thought of messaging my crush through pinterest, my first message was too long(I understood that, I actually don't know how to start or end a conversation, seriously it had been a huge lucture lol!!) But I asked him, in Which school he studied? He told me the name of my former school. I told him, you are the one I wanted to talk with, and I'm with the right person!! He even forgotten my name, but my condition was like, I even remembered every moment with him, That night had been one of my sleepless night!! After that, I made him remember me, I understood if I confess him my love now, he would just push me away, So then I waited I really love to talk to him, And we used to talk every night, He didn't replied so early, but I used to wait for his replies may be for more than half an hour, He started to get fed up with my messages He started asking me questions like where from did I read his blogs,(since I don't have insta and he have never posted his blogs so publicly for me to get an access) Now, I was loaded with questions, that I was forced to tell him, that I loved him once, but I didn't say, that I still have that feeling for him. We used to fight often, and then the problem would be solved within a few days of silence and one day this happened: Him: tell me the truth!! You still love me.. Me: why should I say that to you? Actually I must have said the truth, but I was thinking about my parents, if I start a commitment that would adversely affect our relationship, they have warned me not to start a commitment or stuff, they even don't like me talking with my first cousins(boys). Me: I am waiting to get out of my teen years! Him: then Me: but there is still years to go, yo get out of my teenage Him: do whatever you want Me: ohoo!! Him: love fucks people Me: I don't have any problem Him: I failed in it once, should we? Me: I dunno Our conversation went on… Next day: Me: I talked about something after sometime Him: go get lost!! Me: what?? (Seen) After sometime, Me: dude!! Him: what? Go, go study!! Me: what happened?? (Seen) After sometime Me: can we be in commitment Him: commitment???what? Me: you asked to me if I wanna start a relationship yesterday?? Him: when? Yesterday?? Me: you asked me Him: I don't remember it Me: what?? (Seen) That day had been a hell day of my life, after so many years of hope and love and stuff, I understood, he don't value my love, he actually took it for granted He used to say, he is not eligible for love and stuff, He used to say he feels like to laugh out loud, when I say I loved him..!! I don't even remember his face, I only know his character he used to have then, I loved him for it, only for his character for 3 long years… But he said, everything was my assumptions, and I assume a lot of stuffs, He says, his crush on me, that I mentioned earlier too was my assumption lol!! After that, my parents saw our chats, they yelled at me, they lost their trust, My hell life started, and now…I am dipped in sorrow…I don't have dreams, depressed…I wanna die, why should I live, I feel like even my parents don't wanna know my present mental condition, etc.. But something I wanna say, my love for him doesn't end here, it flows like a river which would never dry…

Lucas,consider this. If you ask a woman out on a date, you are confessing that you like her. You may not have a full out erectile Jones on her, but you like her or are attracted to her enough to want to get to know her- Unless you are asking someone out just to make a status statement to your friends. I never confessed to any woman any feelings like having a crush until I got to know her well enough to know that my feelings were grounded in reality. I recall several girls who I knew in high school who I thought were really hot. I wanted them, but I did not have love for them, since my attraction was superficial,from a distance. I asked these girls out on dates and in each case I found that my imagination was hotter than they were. To answer your question more specificaly, I have never confessed to having a crush on a woman who I had not dated or had not gotten to know in some way. Any time I told a woman ‘I love you’ or ‘I’ve been obsessed with you’., it did not come as a surprise to her. I never just walked up to a female who I was not acquainted with and told her ‘I love you.’ That always seemed stupid to me. I knew people who had done that. I have had it done to me in the past, and from my perspective, it was a pretty stupid thing.

I told her to come over to my dorm and i explicitly toward her that I liked her. She had a surprise look on her face and said “I'm to busy with school and all, but maybe in the future”. In my mind I knew this was some of the excuses that girls pull just let you down easy, but the other half said that there still hope. I said okay and she left. After that she continued to say hi to me and I said hi back. When time preceeded the hellos started to dwindle and I started to panic. I started to become needy and try to start conversation, which was back fire . She gave off signals like she didn't want to talk me. I then backed off and decided to leave her be. I still think about her, but it's probably for the best to move on and meet different people. I'm still hopeful she might come around, but I have learned from this experience and Chase after my goals instead of people for now on.

Yes of course. I’ll be naming them guy #1 and guy #2 . I named them as such in case they find my Quora. Okay, let’s begin! Allow me to contextualize things first. I transferred schools when I was in second grade. I was bullied, but I was able to befriend some of my classmates. One of them was guy #1. Needless to say, I was infatuated with him. I remember saying to my maid once: “I will follow him whenever he goes.” Well, it is a big dream for a child. As an 8-year-old, I was glad to befriend him because of his nice attitude. Years passed. Then it was senior year of high school! the last year before we walk on different paths. Guy #1 and I are still friends. We talk about video games such as Team Fortress, guns, funny videos, and My Little Pony. Admittedly, I still have a crush on him after all those years. My best friends keep teasing me, and coaxing me to confess to him. I mustered the courage to confess. It’s now or never. I approached him and said: “Hey dude! I like you!” I forgot how he reacted, but I think he flinched as soon as those words slipped my mouth. He reciprocated my feelings around 45 minutes later. Did we become a couple? nope. Although Guy #1 said to his friends that we are officially a couple. This is a mistake on his part. We were never a couple, as there was no courtship involved. Sit down, children, and you shall hear the most awkward story of Paul Revere. So, here I am with my best friend in my freshman year of high school, "Karen." Our school had two sets of stairs near the left side of the campus, one set coming down from the main gym, the second coming off of a small exit right next to the gym. We would sit on the second set of stairs, because it has the best view of the campus's relatively forested inner landscape. It was rather beautiful, but we didn't keep it for long. The next week, a sophomore couple making out took our spot. We were slightly annoyed and yelled "get a room!" jokingly. The girl, "Julia", and the guy, "David", both turned to us. Julia had a permanent snooty look on her face, and accordingly sneered at us. David gave us a blank, yet focused look. He was very handsome, though. He was a dirty blonde rugby jock who I had seen a lot around. Deep, piercing blue eyes, the cutest freckles, slightly pointed canines like a sexy wolverine, with a perfect swimmer's build. Sweat-inducing description aside, the next day, they weren't there and we took the spot again. They came back later in the period and saw us; David rose his eyebrows slightly and walked on, while Julia gave her characteristic sneer and then narrowed her eyes at us. The next day, they took the larger steps coming out of the main gym for lunch. We had our spot back, so we stopped thinking about David and Julia. Freshman year passed. As eighth-graders, Karen and I had taken French I online, so we were able to be in French II during 9th grade, and now French III during 10th grade. Now, since everyone *had* to take 2 years of a language to graduate, French I and French II were artificially packed with about 30+ people, but French III was 10–25, and AP French famously had about 5 students. Our teacher, Madame, now that we had more room for everyone, liked mixing us around regularly. That's when I saw David again—-with a black eye. This is odd, but I didn't think black eyes were *actually* something that happened. I thought that they were primarily a visual technique used in popular media to emphasize eye injuries and abrasions. He didn't try to hide it. Anyway, he was rather quiet and was moved from a table of attractive rugby players to a table of four, with a nice goth girl named Angeline, Karen, myself, and David. Mme preferred equal gender division, hence two boys and two girls. We started chatting casually. I assumed he would be some blockhead jock, but after some initial awkwardness about his black eye, wherein he explained he ran into an opposing player during some sort of drill, we started talking about the book he was reading. It was some Chomsky tome critiquing American hegemony, and we talked about American geopolitical history for the rest of the period. Karen, David, and I quickly became friends, but it was obviously that they were becoming a *bit* closer. I was very jealous, but I, for one, wasn't out and wasn't going to entrust some boy I didn't know very well with my secret, and two, I initially didn't want to be a homebreaker. You might ask why Karen, and I later, didn't mind flirting with a committed guy? Well, here's the detour: Back in their early sophomore year, Julia and David began dating; like many petty high school relationships, it was primarily based on sex. The usual Personality-wise, David found in Julia a sort of wallflower quirkiness with her own fire. Julia found a submissive, cute jock that she could dominate. Given more attention, as they matured together, Julia came out of her shell to emerge as a guilt-inducing emotional dictator. Try as he might, David quickly became emotionally drained from her and subsequently ran out of care for her. However, she wouldn't let go, using all of her manipulative powers to hold him by his balls. So...he cheated on her. He cheated with two girls he was relatively close to, some rugby guys, and had a few miscellaneous hookups. You'd think that Julia would be at least a *little* angry and embarrassed as the rumor mill started churning, but, in fact, her best friend, Samantha, had started aggressively hitting on her. Julia wasn't bi, but she craved emotional attention since David started glazing over after she showed her true colors. Julia, having her emotional energy drained by Sam, could only sustain her husk of a relationship with David through guilt and sex. The decreasing marginal returns for her led to David cutting her off during the beginning of his junior year, when he started dating Katie, an artistic hippie who mirrored his own charisma in a uniquely feminine way. At any rate, Karen and David started moving closer. She started showing me their budding flirtatious text conversations, and I resolved myself to squash my jealousy and be a good friend and wingman. There were some problems that they had, though. David had quite a few mental problems that he and I have only fully understood in the last few months. He had borderline personality disorder from parental neglect(he was a stoner who used weed, sex, and Nietzschean existentialism to escape his emotional abandonment-engulfment cycles, as well as significant erraticism.) and complex-PTSD from being sexually abused multiple times by one of his mom's boyfriends during childhood. And so, David wanted-no, needed a benevolent/playful dom to be his partner to satisfy what he and i call his "Oedipenis." A semi-absent mother figure led him to crave an unconditionally loving dominant partner. Yet, due to his fear of being emotionally overwhelmed/engulfed, he made the mistake of choosing quiet wallflowers, who seemed passionate and benevolently dominant, but were secretly abrasive without sufficient social power. He does this a lot. With his friends, from insecure passive-aggressive nerds to frequently socially ignored guitarists to lanky stoners who are slowly figuring out that downing more protein shakes won't fix their low self-esteem to girls with severe daddy issues to extroverted pragmatists who are slowly figuring out that living out the sexual dysfunction "Shameless" won't bring them love, he acts as the mediator, because he subconsciously believes that if he can care for everybody else unconditionally, they will care for him back and not hurt, abandon, or engulf him. Yet, see my TL;DR. He has the same problem that I do. We are both stuck in everlasting struggles. He has aired out his social stress multiple times to me. *sigh* Now, I was really good friends with Karen, but she was too defensive and reliant on others' dominant initiative in a romantic/sexual relationship. Such different starting places, he a neglected stoner who suddenly found the nectar of sex to fix his low self-esteem once puberty and protein powder got through with him, and she a smothered upper-class scene girl, but both seeking the same kind of person...*SIGH*. Obviously deeply incompatible, but I was sublimating my feelings for David vicariously through Karen, so I put on my Machiavellian thinking cap and put in a little elbow grease. This is the immoral tidbit. I decided to help David "develop initiative" and help Karen "be more benevolently dominant" by sending each other specific screenshots of my conversations with them. I would get David texts that showed that Karen would immediately respond as soon as he emotionally affirmed her a *little more.* I would show Karen that based on his increased affirmation, he wanted her to respond a bit more "benevolently dominant." They both took the catnip, and they vastly progressed in their relationship, so much so that their "love" was able to gloss over the fundamental incompatibility. Now, I knew this situation was inherently unsustainable, but I wanted them to get closure with each other first. Eventually, Karen found some screenshots of her texts on my phone(ask people to not swipe if you show them something on your camera roll!) and ratted me out to David. They froze me out, but I still talked to them on an acquaintance basis few and far between. Without my stabilizing and catalyzing influence, their romantic/sexual relationship slowly iced over. They didn't really remain friends, but relapsed into civil acquaintances. I decided that I was acting immaturely by staying quiet, so I reached out to them separately, and slowly rebuilt my friendship with both of them, even as they solidly remained icy for a long time. This was at the end of David's senior year, and after a year and junior prom with Katie, he ended up dating Julia again for his last year, and, with limited time to fix anything, they utterly fell apart aside from random bouts of sex. They both left for different states. That was May 2017, and that fall, I started my senior year. Iced away still from Karen and David, I was relatively quiet on both fronts. The second semester started, and during the first week of January 2018, David sent out multiple texts from a new number saying that he had changed his number. Every since that Chomsky conversation, we have both had jokingly political conversation, him being an anarcho-syndicalist, but we joke about him being a primitivist hermit, and me always being a committed communist. We talked about Nietzsche's pithy statement about how one's biography determines their life philosophy, and how his free-spirited nature led to his more left-libertarian stance, and my own stiff immigrant upbringing led to my own strict communism. This led into speaking about weed, which weirdly ended up one February night in us talking about our sexual exploits. I was still scared to out myself to him, but we happened to chance upon his gay rugby exploits in our conversation, which I hadn't known about beforehand. I weighed the odds, and I decided that there was a negligible chance that he'd reveal my secret if I just told him, so I decided to just be open. It worked out, gladly. He was happy that I was open with him, and we swapped our "conquest" stories. We continued talking about anything and everything, from the intersection of modernism with Goedel's incompleteness theorem to masturbating to each other in the past to politics to tech and our childhoods and our personal psychoanalyses. We talked for hours every day over text and frequently called for hours in the evening. I know, I know, the soothing effect of some odd actualization of my long-repressed crush was probably subsidizing problems I couldn't see that I was rushing hundreds of miles per hour into an open maw. From Feb-May, the romantic ante was constantly upped, and we started having skirmishes about where we were going emotionally. Initially, he'd be hesitant, considering how hurt he was by Rachel, but he'd still brazenly flirt with me. He talked about not trusting me yet, and then oscillating again into saying he did have feelings for me. By mid-May, he said he was coming back to my city to visit family during the second week of June. He grew readily more confident, and amidst completely unrelated conversation during one of our night calls, he said he had definite romantic feelings for me and he wanted to plan a "friendly outing" when he got back. This made me internally giddy, but, ever the stoic rationalist, I responded with a moderate and not overwhelming amount of joy. It was confusing, but asking him in a forthright manner led to him saying he was generally just confused about the nature of his feelings due to his failed relationships, but he did want to start to engage and flirt with me, which I had been doing all along. I've asked him how he knew his feelings were legitimate. He cheated on so many people. Why wouldn't he cheat on me if we did grow closer? He replied by saying that even without physicality, I had been there for him intellectually and emotionally.(This was sort of obvious, seeing as he only initiates with broken people as a therapist, but our organic situation had no D/S dynamic.) "I've never been present during sex with women, and other guys are usually callous, closeted, or cold." Months of interpersonal analysis led to us figuring out that he was just gay, and the women always fulfilled some need. Now, I know the skeptic's soapbox well, and I know it seems like I might be so inundated with my puppy love that I was at his mental hand and foot that he was just enjoying the level of control he had over me, but, again, I am ever the stoic rationalist. I have, I do, and I will enthusiastically criticize and discuss anything with anyone, and my passion ends where irrationality starts. We have definitely dipped and risen many times. Sappy bullshit aside, I think he just wanted an equal. Hedonism with his newfound desirability was all fine and dandy, but that didn't cover up the parental neglect or abuse. The only sustainable way to have perpetual and self-contained happiness is family values. Obviously not the homophobic, regressive brand of "family values" we all know and love, but the sense of community, loyalty, and altruism that usually exists in a nuclear family, but can just as easily be created within a band of lifelong friends or a polyamorous BDSM commune. A family is composed of self-supporting and inter-supporting equals having unconditional love for one another, and David has been screwed over by, well, everyone. It's odd, but I think that I am the first person who has ever actually expected some degree of mutual respect from him. Among most people, he was this charismatic rugby jock with a brilliant mind and a gleaming smile, a big man on campus who must be venerated, to his friends, in many ways, he was their emotional leader and idol, and in the context of his divorced parents, he was an insignificant kid who they didn't consider when breaking up. But seeing him as a person and insisting that he see me as a person as well...it may very well be the first relationship he had ever been in that was between equals. Borderline people usually display a deep lack of self-awareness, but I think I forced him to consider the moral responsibility of being a functional emotional adult. I chose to believe that, since I am deeply compatible with him in almost every way, from sharing interests on anthropology, philosophy, blacksmithing, physical activity, relationships, a variety of miscellaneous hobbies, and more. We always organically meeting in the middle, and, as you can tell by now, I'm certainly long-winded enough and perhaps substantive enough to talk about everything. However, we still had regular issues, primarily about trust and fear of the other, but a night of cathartic conversation resolved everything every time. June came, and with the sweltering heat came the increasing heat in both of our nether regions. Sexting grew more frequent. Then the day came. I removed any blackheads, double-showered, and then I saw him for the first time for over a year. We went walking in our local park, and a general mix of low-tier apprehension and joy dominated(retroactively confirming) both our minds. We got to a tiny grotto next to a bridge, and I remembered how serene the bridge was during a past phone call with him. Overcome with emotion, I went in and kissed him. It was pretty intense for me, and he was obviously aroused, as he went in for tongue, which was a first for me, but i attempted to match his moves. He must be very experienced, I thought. My schizoid traits make me overly analytical, though, as I kept my eyes open. We then continued walking until he grabbed my shoulder and asked me to follow him; we ended up in this meadow blocked from the path's view, and mild oral and vigorous making out ensued. After that, we went back to his car, and he started telling me about a once-off fling with an old friend(female) and having parallel-romantic feelings for her. That made me feel bad, but I didn't want to ruin the tenor of the date. The day ended, and when I got home, I sent him a few romantic texts, and when he didn't respond that night(he went out to reconnect with some friends; I'm not trying to be a jailer, as how I feel is not his responsibility.), I remembered the fling he talked about, and how he used to have a harem of cheerleader girls, and now seemed like he was trying to subconsciously groom me to be part of some hyper-manipulative neo-harem now that he was trying out his gay side, and I remembered how he blocked me out for months when I tried to be honest with him and Karen. He just never seemed to respect me, and no matter how direct I was, he would never truly be himself, as happy as he was. So, I just stopped talking to him. I got into a rut of overworking and engaging more in my hobbies to just get away from him. And then the switches flipped, as he'd text me, e-mail me, and call me incessantly about how much he wanted me in his life and how much he wanted to talk to me, if only briefly. A month later, I accidentally butt-texted him, and he jumped on the text immediately. I'm obsessed with logical consistency(daddy issues; my parents wouldn't care about my input or respect my agency where it was important and where my siblings got respect, so I believed if I only spoke in terms of logical order, they couldn't invalidate my words, because the onus would be on the validity of my facts and not on how high they valued my opinion), and so I sought to apologize for the accident. He may have misconstrued my words as me being ready to speak on romantic terms again, but I remained icy for a few days, but he has this way of making me feel grounded and happy, so within the next few days, I semi-formally asked him to be my boyfriend. He agreed with his usual easy mirth, and the rest of July was identical to our prior romantic months, but he would engage more by proactively sending me fun memes and strong insights every morning. I sublimated my jealousy into productive curiosity, and we learned more about each other, that he had borderline adaptations and I had schizoid adaptations, and that he had been sexually abused by one of his mom's string of boyfriends in eighth grade, and, as such, he was co-morbid with complex PTSD as well. Everything seemed to be getting worse and better at the same time, but it all came to a head last August, wherein it was just more work for him, but I started college, and he completely did a 180 and said he wanted to just be friends, and he just retreated into his shell and more or less rejected me, not responding to anything, and when I got stressed out and asked for an explanation, he blocked me. I sent an e-mail just to confirm the block(it was at night) wasn't just a glitch and to let out all my feelings, and he shortly unblocked me, going back and forth on blocking about nine times from August to October, wherein I became progressively more depressed, and he oscillated between hurtfully comparing me to his caustic ex and then growing softer whilst reminiscing about our good times. A little before my birthday in late October hit, he released his pressure and apologized for his past three months of behavior, attributing his behavior to intense paranoia related to Julia and a feeling of replicative abuse of his neglectful and divorced parents, as well as his rapist. Shortly after this, I got into a car crash and received a concussion. I spiraled when I read a Reddit post on r/gaybros that I thought was him, and I told him my fear about his old friend and his trust issues and our collective neuroses in general. He got into his tribal mediator mode and said that he had confirmed he was gay, and that the dissociating sex with women was a borderline defense mechanism to try to attain attention from a strong female, i.e. mommy issues. There was a lot of talking about how nuanced and caring I was and how he cherished my mental intensity even in the emotional moments when his exes or friends would have disparaged or ignored him. It did console me, and November and December were perfect in their romantic feeling. As Winter Break pulled closer and David was planning a holiday visit, we planned to get a hotel room for a night. A week before our meeting, he told me about feeling nauseated every few months when he thought about how he hurt the girls in his past harem, and I pushed him to resolve his issues with Julia by unblocking her and directly texting her. He did, promptly came out to her, told her who he was dating, and they made a date to see each other. He was fantastically happy to finally get closure, and she only reacted positively, but the next morning, there was a twist. He told me about having recurrent sexual feelings for her and then how he wanted to maintain an open relationship. I have nothing against poly people, but...not for me. I just said that if he is obligate poly(as opposed to facultative), then we could just be friends. He became panicky and scared, and then he internalized the shame and stopped talking to me. I then called him; he said he prioritized me and wanted monogamy, and we came to a consensus of polyamory being his mode of weakening intimacy, so he wouldn't feel emotionally engulfed, i.e. borderline defense mechanism. This seemed tenable for the time being, but then we met up on January 1st. Part of the whole submission-to-women complex used to involve oscillating with trans feelings and crossdressing desires. Julia used to dress him up in her skirts, panties, and/or lingerie whilst she would use a strapon on him. Part of the date was going to be going to this lingerie shop downtown, subsequently buying some books and getting coffee. My little kinky existentialist(too bad I'm a thorough modernist), lol. Yet, I suddenly stopped getting text responses the morning of. I called him multiple times, received no response, and with a curious dismissal, I slowly paled into the realization that he got cold feet. Ha! My hedonistic womanizer, nervous of me, some random short guy, and not his aggressively dominant exes and ruthless friends? Maybe he didn't want me anymore. Who ignores someone when they're frantic for months(after the Karen crisis) or after uninterrupted bliss(last July)? I knew there had to be some catch to getting the perfect guy. I mean, who gets their straight hunky crush to fall in love with them, have deeply engaging conversation with them on all levels without end in sight, come out with them, and go through so much simultaneous growth? That's every young gay guy's erstwhile dream. Who was I, a try-hard nerdy guy, to get such a perfect partner right at the exact cusp of my budding adulthood? Write a note and pass it to your crush or make a creative card. Notes are one of the most common and effective ways to confess a crush. It tends to be less awkward than in-person confessions, giving you some space and comfort if the person doesn't feel the same way. Write a short note confessing your crush, and pass it to the person in person, or put it in their locker. Make sure your note is hand-written, legible, and relatively short and to the point. It doesn't need to be clever, or overly romantic. Just cut to the chase: "I've always noticed that you seem really sweet, kind, and cute. I'd love to get to know you better, because I really like you." When you want to confess to your crush, in person is always better than just over a text, or online. A note is a good balance, because it can be personal, but also gives you some space if you're nervous. If all else fails, having a conversation on the phone, or via Skype is always preferable to texting it. Introduce the idea without saying anything. In some cases, your actions can make your crush more obvious than saying, "You know, I really like you." If your crush gradually becomes aware that you like them, it'll be more natural and clear than having to say so bluntly. Go out of your way to talk to your crush and "accidentally" bump into them in the hallway. Change your routes so you see them regularly, and always make a point of saying hi. Always make eye-contact. Don't shy away from it, like you're embarrassed. Make eye contact and smile flirtatiously when you see the person you're crushing on. Show an interest in what they do and what they are like. Try to get to know your crush as a friend first, before you confess anything. It may grow naturally. Ask for help with something. One great way to start a conversation or to get your crush talking is to ask some help with something simple. Depending on who your crush is and what they're like, this can get you into some flirtatious conversations. Ask for help with a homework assignment for a class that you're in together. Start with a compliment, like, "You seem so smart in this class. Do you think we could talk a little sometime about this assignment? I need some help." Asking for help will make them think respectfully of you, and they'll think you're honest enough to ask for help on something. Also, them helping you will make their overall feelings for you kinder. Pretend you lost something. "Hey, have you seen a book around here? I just had it..." When your crush helps out, say, "You're so sweet..."

Honestly, I felt a lot more comfortable opening up because I knew that at the point she didn't have a shot with me, so I didn't expect an answer or anything. It just felt nice to make someone happy.

Confessing to your crush by telling them you love them can turn out good or ugly. There’s a saying which says ‘do the right thing at the right time’. The atmosphere and timing of when to profess your love for your crush is important. Let me break it down; If you tell them at the wrong time such as when he/she isn’t feeling the same way, or when they are in a really bad mood or when they have pressings issues to attend, it could turn out ugly. Also the atmosphere is very important. You don’t want to profess your love to your crush when they are in the midst of their friends, oh mine! It could be very embarrassing. You also don’t want to tell them when they are with their parents or guardian, don’t attempt it. You can invite your crush to dinner, a picnic or any event that would be really nice. Talk gently and before you know it that opportunity to say it will come naturally and you can tell him/her. I bet there’s much more chance things will go well. Cheers.
